dialogues.speaker: NEW YORK CITY
dialogues.text: A TAXI pulls over to a curb where an ELDERLY MAN waits wi his MIDDLE-AGED SON in THE RAIN.

dialogues.speaker: MIDDLE-AGED SON
dialogues.text: (as they climb in) 23rd and Lex. The CABBIE grunts a reply.

dialogues.speaker: MIDDLE-AGED SON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How ya doin', Papa, you doin' alright?

dialogues.speaker: ELDERLY MAN
dialogues.text: Fine, fine...

dialogues.speaker: MIDDLE-AGED SON
dialogues.text: This is just a check-up, okay? Doctor Katz says you'll outlive us all. (looks out the window) Traffic isn't bad. We should be back in time to watch the Mets. He notices his father is STARING, wide-eyed, at the cabby HACK LICENSE. We glimpse only the last name..."Bielski."

dialogues.speaker: MIDDLE-AGED SON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Papa? .Papa, what is it? IN THE REAR VIEW MIRROR, the old man catches the furtive eyes of the cabby.

dialogues.speaker: ELDERLY MAN
dialogues.text: ...You. Can it be? The eyes in the mirror look away. And then back.

dialogues.speaker: ELDERLY MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bielski. Can it possibly be? As we PUSH IN on the eyes in the mirror, we HEAR THE DESPERATE RASPING SOUND OF PANTING.

dialogues.speaker: A MAN RUNNING FOR HIS LIFE THROUGH THE WOODS. 2
dialogues.text: Bombs EXPLODE all around as he passes dead bodies and BUR OUT VEHICLES. Without slowing he discards a WW II Red Arm helmet, a field jacket, a heavy pack, anything that might impede his flight. He glances back up over his shoulder. The sky is filled with BOMBERS. He runs on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SALMON Revision - 8-18-07 2.

dialogues.speaker: THE VILLAGE OF NALIBOKI 4
dialogues.text: A typical Eastern European shtetl. LOCAL POLICE help Germ Einsatzgruppen, mobile killing squads, round up Jews. PEASANTS beat them with sticks as they are herded into li One man tries to run and is beaten. Others look on, or look away with indifference as they ar loaded onto waiting trucks. 5 TWO MEN HIDE IN THE NEARBY WOODS (ZUS & ASAEL BIELS We study their faces: a turbulent portrait of impotent ra terrible fear, overwhelming grief, and secret relief.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: Where are they taking them?

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: --Shveig! Shveig!

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: Just shut up! Please...

dialogues.speaker: AN ALLEY WAY IN NOVAGRUDOK 6
dialogues.text: The man we last saw in flight (TUVIA BIELSKI) wearing the remnants of his uniform, slips down a cobble-stoned stree He ducks into a doorway as A PATROL passes by.

dialogues.speaker: 6A A REMOTE FARM 6A
dialogues.text: Zus and Asael move warily through a barnyard. A tethered dog BARKS furiously. A farmer challenges them.

dialogues.speaker: WALENCKI
dialogues.text: (in Russian; subtitles)

dialogues.speaker: WHAT DO YOU WANT
dialogues.text: Walencki brandishes a pitchfork.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: (in Russian; subtitles) Some food...?

dialogues.speaker: WALENCKI
dialogues.text: They are looking for you people. The two brothers glance nervously around.

dialogues.speaker: WALENCKI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get away from here! GO! ZUS, the older of the two brothers, takes a menacing step toward the farmer but his younger brother holds him back. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SALMON Revision - 8-19-07 3.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: Zus. Let's go. As they retreat toward the woods, Zus warns the farmer.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: We'll be back.

dialogues.speaker: A BOURGEOIS APARTMENT
dialogues.text: Tuvia is getting dressed as AN ATTRACTIVE WOMAN -- his wi RIFKA -- stands by the window, smoking a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: And no news of my brothers?

dialogues.speaker: RIFKA
dialogues.text: They are used to trouble, they'll be all right.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: If you stay, you'll have to go to the ghetto.

dialogues.speaker: RIFKA
dialogues.text: I can get false papers and pass as a gentile. So can you. Tuvia shakes his head, no. He finishes dressing. Theirs is a relationship long past passion.

dialogues.speaker: RIFKA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Will you at least stay tonight?

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: I need to see to my family. Will you come?

dialogues.speaker: RIFKA
dialogues.text: To the country? No.

dialogues.speaker: A MODEST MILL
dialogues.text: A PAIR OF LEGS lie motionless behind a trough. Beyond, A MAN'S TORSO. Zus and Asael stare in mute horror.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: Papa-- Gottenyu... Flies buzz about dead LIVESTOCK. A WOMAN'S BODY lies near

dialogues.speaker: IN THE HOUSE 9
dialogues.text: A still portrait of a life interrupted. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE GREEN Revision - 10-14-07 4.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A table set for dinner. Candles lit. An open book. A NOISE from a cupboard. Zus grabs a hatchet. From the root cellar, a YOUNG BOY, 14, appears. His face is dirty and tear-streaked. They go to embrace him.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: Aron. The boy (ARON) recoils. He is disoriented and WILL NOT SPEAK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loaded down with possessions, Asael hurries back to the woods. Zus pauses long enough to pry the mezuzah from the door.

dialogues.speaker: THE FOREST AT DUSK 10
dialogues.text: Aron stares mutely straight ahead. Asael is shaking uncontrollably and crying. Zus is at a loss what to do.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: Stop it... But Asael is lost in a confusion of grief and panic.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Stop it. STOP IT! Finally Zus grabs him in a gesture halfway between violen and comfort...and holds him as Asael rocks back and forth

dialogues.speaker: THE NALIBOKI FOREST AT DAWN
dialogues.text: A million acres of dense, impenetrable woods and swamps.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL AND ARON SLEEP HUDDLED ON THE GROUND 12
dialogues.text: The sound of a FOOTSTEP. They sit up in terror.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: If I was a German you are dead.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: Tuvia! Asael leaps up to embrace him as if he were salvation its

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Papa and Mama. They killed them. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TAN Revision - 9-10-07 5.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Asael clings to him. Even Aron allows himself to be held. Tuvia hold them silently. Zus appears, hatchet in hand.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: Big brother returns. Tuvia and Zus look at each other warily.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You saw them? Yes. Tuvia saw them. Zus takes the mezuzah from his pocke tosses it to Tuvia.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Welcome home.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: is torn apart by filthy hands as they move through the tr

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: Are you going back to the army?

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: There is no more army. Asael worships his big brother.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: Hope at least you killed a few. Tuvia just stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: What is it like? To be in a war?

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: It wasn't war. It was something else. Zus eyes him carefully.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where is Sonia and the baby?

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: Horodysze. Hiding in a cellar. I'll bring her when it is safe. Where is Rifka?

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: In Novgrudok. She wouldn't leave.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: You are still separated?

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: She is still my wife. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YELLOW Revision - 7-30-07 6.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: Your rich wife. Zus chews with the open-mouthed relish of a peasant.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So why exactly have you come back? Tuvia just stares at him. The reason is obvious as he hol his younger brothers.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You have a plan?

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: No. Do you?

dialogues.speaker: POURING RAIN
dialogues.text: Shivering and miserable, they are trying to start a fire. Asael's few remaining matches are sodden.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Is there anything left to eat? Only a few potatoes in Asael's bag. WORMS writhe among them.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: Zus finished the last of the sausage. Tuvia glares at Zus, who glares back. Sibling rivals.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: Stankowicz' farm is closest.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: He has dogs.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: Fuck the dogs. Wilencki then.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: You think Wilencki is going to give us food?

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: No. We take it.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: We...Take...It. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SALMON Revision - 8-18-07 7.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: And he tells the police.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: I have run from the police my whole life. Do you really think it's a good time to stop? A moment of decision. Who holds the balance of power?

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: We know these woods. They'll never find us in here. Tuvia looks at his brothers. He has been outvoted.

dialogues.speaker: THE SMALL FARMHOUSE 15
dialogues.text: where Zus and Asael first tried to get food. Asael waits outside, anxiously on guard.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE 16
dialogues.text: The farmer (WALENCKI) who threatened them with the pitchf sits eating a simple dinner. Zus and Tuvia burst in. Zus brandishes a hoe.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: (in Russian; subtitles) We want food. Be quick about it!

dialogues.speaker: WALENCKI
dialogues.text: (in Russian; subtitles) You again!

dialogues.speaker: WALENCKI
dialogues.text: Sure, sure. Take what you want... Tuvia begins to stuff provisions into a sack.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: Where is your gun, farmer?

dialogues.speaker: WALENCKI
dialogues.text: I have no gun. Zus grabs a dinner plate and SMASHES IT IN THE FARMER'S FACE.

dialogues.speaker: WHERE IS YOUR GUN
dialogues.text: Holding his bloody face, the farmer cowers in fear. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GOLDENROD Revision - 8-16-07 8.

dialogues.speaker: WALENCKI
dialogues.text: Please... Zus kicks him.

dialogues.speaker: WALENCKI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I beg you...

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: He's lying. He kicks him again. The farmer begins to weep.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're lying! Zus dumps the remains of the farmer's dinner onto him.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If I hit you once more, you will shit your pants. Twice and you will never shit again. The farmer knows Zus won't hesitate.

dialogues.speaker: WALENCKI
dialogues.text: Up there... Zus kicks the man aside. Above the stove is an old rifle. Zus grabs it, points it at the farmer.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: We were never here.

dialogues.speaker: THE BROTHERS 17
dialogues.text: running through the woods. Zus raises the rifle in triump

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: He was willing to help us.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: He's lucky I didn't crush his head. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TAN Revision - 9-10-07 9.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fucking Polack. I've eaten shit from these people long enough!

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: This is your plan? To terrorize every anti-Semite in Belorussia?

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: No. Some I will kill.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER PART OF THE FOREST 18
dialogues.text: Aron has been left alone. He holds a STICK which he "shoo like a gun -- kachew -- as he creeps from tree to tree. Aron freezes. SOMETHING is moving in the trees. He crouches. A dark blur. An animal? It moves off. He follow The shape appears again. It's a SMALL GIRL, roughly Aron' age. Aron waves at her. The girl stares, then runs off. Aron hurries after her into a wooded grove, then stops sh A PILE OF NAKED CORPSES. Overflows a newly-dug trench. The small girl runs to A MIDDLE-AGED MAN with a crude Star-of-David sewn to his tattered coat. He holds an OLDER GIRL, 14, in his arms. Nearby, three or four OTHERS emerge from hiding. Starved, in tatters, the living waiting to die.

dialogues.speaker: A CLEARING
dialogues.text: where the three brothers gorge themselves on stolen food. Someone FARTS loudly.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: Ah...

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: You know what Papa would do when you did that at table... Tuvia smacks Zus on the head, taking on a gruff voice.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Peasant. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TAN Revision - 9-10-07 10.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Tuvia imitates his father's criticism of Zus. Asael laugh Zus can't help but laugh as well. Even in grief there is laughter. A glimpse of ties that bind them.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: I can't believe Papa's dead.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: Bernicki.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: The police captain?

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: We don't know he did it.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: He always had it in for Papa.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: We don't know he did it.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: So we will go and ask him if he did.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: Koscik has a pistol. He showed it to me once.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: One pistol isn't enough. We need rifles. Machine guns.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Machine guns? You're going to take on the whole German army?

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: Just because you didn't... The SOUND of footsteps. Zus jumps up cocking the rifle. ARON emerges from the trees. And then, behind him, THE SURVIVORS he discovered among the corpses. THE MIDDLE-AGED MAN holds a teenage GIRL by one hand and carries his younger daughter.

dialogues.speaker: MIDDLE-AGED MAN
dialogues.text: The child is hurt. The brothers stare at him. Wary and unwelcoming.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Set her down. The man lowers the child to the ground. She isn't moving.

dialogues.speaker: MIDDLE-AGED MAN
dialogues.text: I am Avram Rubinski. This is my daughter. She-- The Germans-- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GOLDENROD Revision - 8-16-07 11.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He cannot bring himself to say the words. OTHERS shuffle forward, still in shock, barely able to speak their grati as Tuvia offers chunks of bread and cheese. The man tries to feed his daughter. She is barely alive. Asael turns to Aron. Gently.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: Where did you find them? Aron still won't speak. Asael addresses the other girl.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Your sister is sick?

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE GIRL, (RACHEL)
dialogues.text: They kept her for a week. We fill in the rest.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA--
dialogues.text: Zus has moved out of earshot. Tuvia joins him.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We cannot feed them.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: I'll go ask Koscik for food.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: And the pistol.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: And the pistol. Without another word, he starts off.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: Remember to say please.

dialogues.speaker: A RUSSIAN-MADE MAHKAROV REVOLVER. 20
dialogues.text: Koscik, a rotund, florid-faced Pole, hands it to Tuvia.

dialogues.speaker: KOSCIK
dialogues.text: I have only four bullets. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLUE Revision - 6-26-07 12.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: I cannot thank you enough. They sit in Koscik's warmly-lit kitchen. Koscik's WIFE stands silently by the stove, glaring at Tuvia.

dialogues.speaker: KOSCIK
dialogues.text: Your father was a good man.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: He said the same of you. Tuvia can't help but notice Koscik's wife giving him the evil eye. Koscik produces a bottle of vodka.

dialogues.speaker: KOSCIK
dialogues.text: Ignore the bitch. (raising the bottle) To the dead. God rest their souls. (in Russian; subtitles) Bitch-- Do you want vodka? His wife just glares at him.

dialogues.speaker: KOSCIK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I live with this, can you imagine? HEADLIGHTS sweep over the window. A CAR is fast approachi

dialogues.speaker: KOSCIK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hide yourself. ...The barn. 21 TUVIA HURRIES ACROSS THE COURTYARD AND INTO THE BARN.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE LOFT 22
dialogues.text: He climbs a ladder and is startled to find FIVE MORE MEN AND WOMEN in hiding. They stare in mute terror.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE BARN 23
dialogues.text: Koscik greets A BELARUSSIAN POLICE CAPTAIN and his SONS a they exit the car. They speak in Russian, with subtitles:

dialogues.speaker: KOSCIK
dialogues.text: Working late, boys.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Hunting Jews. Our new bosses are very organized. Koscik offers the bottle.

dialogues.speaker: KOSCIK
dialogues.text: Hunting can work up a thirst. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SALMON Revision - 8-19-07 13.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Fifteen in one day. The council is offering a year's free tax for every one you turn in. -

dialogues.speaker: KOSCIK
dialogues.text: A Jew is worth that much? Do you pay more for a fat one? They laugh appreciatively.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE LOFT 24
dialogues.text: A man COUGHS then shrugs an apology. Tuvia glares at him.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Caught five of them hiding in a ditch. Smelled so bad I was afraid the Germans wouldn't want them.

dialogues.speaker: KOSCIK
dialogues.text: Maybe for a reduced price. More laughter. More vodka.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: You know the Bielski's?

dialogues.speaker: KOSCIK
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: We missed two when we visited the parents.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE LOFT 26
dialogues.text: Tuvia listens to this casual talk of his parent's death.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Anybody caught helping them is in for it. You know this, Koscik?

dialogues.speaker: KOSCIK
dialogues.text: Do I look like an idiot? Don't answer so quickly... More laughter. The Police Captain looks at his watch. Yawns. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GOLDENROD Revision - 8-16-07 14.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Been at it since dawn. The wife doesn't like these long nights. He tries to hand back the bottle to Koscik.

dialogues.speaker: KOSCIK
dialogues.text: Keep it.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Bribing an officer of the law? Maybe you have more of this black market vodka hidden in the barn?

dialogues.speaker: KOSCIK
dialogues.text: Take a look. And clean out the cow shit while you're back there. The policeman laughs and climbs back into the car.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: You'll keep your eyes open, yes?

dialogues.speaker: KOSCIK
dialogues.text: Good hunting.

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Koscik and Tuvia speak in harsh whispers.

dialogues.speaker: KOSCIK
dialogues.text: --If the laborers find them tomorrow, I will be denounced--

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: What am I supposed to do with--

dialogues.speaker: KOSCIK
dialogues.text: Take them into the forest--

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: --And feed them how? I can't care for my own family. Behind them, several of the REFUGEES have emerged from th hiding place. They stare at Tuvia balefully.

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: The refugees are loaded with provisions. A young man, PIN ZUCKERMAN, has a tethered GOAT. Another man carries a vio case. Koscik hands Tuvia another bottle of vodka.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Those men? They were the ones who killed my parents? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GOLDENROD Revision - 8-16-07 15.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Koscik doesn't want to tell him. Finally he nods, yes.

dialogues.speaker: KOSCIK
dialogues.text: You people. Why is it so fucking hard to be friends with a Jew? They embrace.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Imagine being one. Tuvia leads his motley band toward the woods.

dialogues.speaker: A FOREST TRAIL
dialogues.text: Tuvia leads them. He notices an OLD MAN staring at him.

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN
dialogues.text: You sat in back. Tuvia just looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: In school. I am Shimon H'aretz.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: I thought you were dead.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMON
dialogues.text: I am at least half-dead. (after a moment) I heard them speaking of your parents. I am very sorry. Tuvia shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And the other brothers? What was his name, the wild one?

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Zus. He's with the other two.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMON
dialogues.text: You are hiding here? In the forest? Tuvia nods.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There has been trouble before maybe? With the police? Tuvia doesn't answer. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE BLUE Revision - 9-17-07 16.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So now you go to the forest. A wise choice.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: For a dumb schoolboy, you mean.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMON
dialogues.text: My whole life I presumed to teach others the right way to live. I had no doubt: this is God's way, this isn't. You'll forgive me if recent events have somewhat shaken my resolve.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: It is just like school, I don't know what you're talking about. (touching him) Teacher...Come... Come. (gesturing to the

dialogues.speaker: FOLLOWERS
dialogues.text: Please.

dialogues.speaker: THE CLEARING
dialogues.text: The new arrivals squat by a fire where potatoes are cooki in the ashes. Everyone shares from the soup pot. There aren't enough spoons to go around. Shimon offers Aron something to eat.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMON
dialogues.text: Here... You're not hungry? Aron doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The little one does not talk?

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: He saw. Things.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA, MEANWHILE
dialogues.text: stares fixedly as Avram digs his daughter's grave. The gu is still in his belt. Zus is constructing a shelter.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: I send you for food and you bring more mouths to feed.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: You send me?

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: Did you at least get the gun? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE GREEN Revision - 10-14-07 16A.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Tuvia shows him.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Only four bullets.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: Then we'll have to make them count. Zus heads for the food. Asael is trying to start a fire but the kindling is wet.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMON
dialogues.text: Here... Shimon takes a book from his coat, rips out pages covered in Hebrew and crumples them into the fire. They burst int flame.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The Psalms have many uses.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS SITS AMONG THE NEWCOMERS
dialogues.text: watching as they eat hungrily. Tuvia stops near Avram DIGGING a grave before heading out of the camp. We realize Avram's daughter has died while Tuvia was away. THE SOUND OF DISTANT THUNDER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE BLUE Revision - 9-17-07 17.

dialogues.speaker: A LONE FARMHOUSE
dialogues.text: Tuvia stands in the driving rain, shaking. He stares at t lit windows.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE HOUSE 34
dialogues.text: The POLICE CAPTAIN we saw earlier eats dinner with his WI and TWO SONS. They speak in Russian.

dialogues.speaker: WIFE
dialogues.text: You worked late. The man nods, his mouth full of food.

dialogues.speaker: WIFE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tomorrow is Sunday. You have a day off, yes?

dialogues.speaker: POLICE CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: (still chewing; nods) ...Fucking SS never sleeps... The door OPENS slowly. They all look up. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YELLOW Revision - 7-30-07 18.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Tuvia stands on the threshold, dripping wet, a spectral figure. He holds the pistol at his side.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: You know who I am? The policeman says nothing. His wife is instantly terrifi One of the SONS stands. Tuvia turns the gun on him.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sit. The son obeys. The SOUND of the rain on the tin roof is deafening. Tuvia turns back to the Police Captain.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And you know why I am here.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: ...what are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: You have no idea what I'm talking about...

dialogues.speaker: POLICE CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: If they say find someone, I find him. It's my job.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: To find Jews.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Or lose my job.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: And it's a good job, isn't it? You like your job.

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN
dialogues.text: I was always fair with your family. ...Everyone knew you were smuggling this and that. But I looked the other way. (in desperation) ...Ask your father.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: My father? You don't talk about my father... Tuvia places the pistol against the man's forehead.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Down on your knees. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE YELLOW Revision - 10-8-07 19.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (BELLOWING)

dialogues.speaker: ON...YOUR...KNEES...PIG
dialogues.text: The policeman begins to weep.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: For my parents, David and Beila Bielski... for my brothers and all the others--

dialogues.speaker: POLICE CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Please.... I beg you... One of the man's SONS makes a move toward Tuvia. Tuvia SHOOTS him in the chest. His mother SCREAMS. The Policema suddenly starts to stand. Tuvia backs away, shoots him. And then the other son. It is all over in seconds.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA STANDS THERE, FROZEN 36
dialogues.text: The police captain's wife is prostrate and KEENING over h dead family in Russian.

dialogues.speaker: WIFE
dialogues.text: Kill me, too! Tuvia should indeed kill her, too. To avoid being identified.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Tell them who did this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rain still pours down on the house as Tuvia runs away

dialogues.speaker: A FOREST TRAIL
dialogues.text: Tuvia pushes through dense forest. Branches rake his face Finally he leans against a tree. We move CLOSE on his fac

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Riboynoy shel oylam, riboynoy shel oylam... (closes his eyes) Lord of the universe, forgive me, I have murdered -- but they were monsters and did not deserve to live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE BLUE Revision - 9-17-07 20.

dialogues.speaker: NEXT MORNING
dialogues.text: Zus awakens, sodden and stiff. He looks at the group, now numbering fourteen. People sleep huddled together: Asael holds Aron; Avram keeps his surviving daughter close. And there is Tuvia -- sitting by the fire. Zus takes the pistol from Tuvia's belt. Checks the cylinder.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: Only one bullet left.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: His sons. Zus nods his approval.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: How was it?

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: To kill them. It was good, no?

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Shut up. Tuvia stares into the fire. He is dirty and tired. Zus looks around.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: What are we going to do with these others?

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: I don't know--

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: The women will slow us down. And your old teacher--

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: You're afraid he's going to beat you for forgetting your homework.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: We have to be able to keep moving, and quickly.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: I agree. But they're here. They consider their predicament. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE GREEN Revision - 10-14-07 21.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We'll sleep farther up the trail. If anyone comes, they'll find them first. The gunshots will give us time to escape.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: Alright. But no more.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: No more.

dialogues.speaker: SEVERAL MORE REFUGEES 39
dialogues.text: stumbling into camp behind Tuvia, who carries a heavy sac of provisions. Zus gives Tuvia a look.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: I know. I know... Tamara, you remember Cousin Zus. Please, go sit down by the fire. And this is Lazar -- Isabel's youngest... Tamara is pleasant-looking but emotionally wounded.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is Isaac Malbin. From Minsk. Malbin is sweet-faced with little round Trotsky glasses.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Asael, find them something to eat.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: Zus takes Tuvia aside.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: Tuvia, I have pity for them all,

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: They are family.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: And how will we feed this family?

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: We'll water the soup. One of the new arrivals is a DARK-HAIRED BEAUTY. Tuvia an Zus watch her pass. Zus is particularly interested.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: And this one, is she family?

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: No. By the fire, the veterans pepper the newcomers with (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE GREEN Revision - 10-14-07 A21.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: questions. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE BLUE Revision - 9-17-07 21A.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: You are from Lida! Is Isadore Korein alive?

dialogues.speaker: LOVA
dialogues.text: There are so many in the ghetto, I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: TAMARA
dialogues.text: Does anyone have news from Vilna?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE BLUE Revision - 9-17-07 22.

dialogues.speaker: 40A ANOTHER DAY
dialogues.text: Food, such as it is, is being handed out to SEVERAL NEW ARRIVALS. Asael brushes Aron's hair. Rachel sits beside her grieving father. She looks at Aron. He looks back. Nearby, Tuvia and Malbin are building a shelter. Malbin i hopelessly inept. A wall COLLAPSES.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Fuck me! Have you never used a hammer?

dialogues.speaker: MALBIN
dialogues.text: Uh. No.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: What is it you do, then?

dialogues.speaker: MALBIN
dialogues.text: I suppose...you'd have to say...I was...am...an intellectual.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: This is a job?

dialogues.speaker: MALBIN
dialogues.text: I published a small magazine... actually a journal...well, more like a pamphlet. Zus passes them, his arm around the dark-haired beauty.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: Tuvia, this is Rona. Rona is my forest wife.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: I see. Congratulations. Zus winks and walks past. Malbin and Tuvia watch them.

dialogues.speaker: MALBIN
dialogues.text: Interesting concept.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: As long as his village wife stays in hiding.

dialogues.speaker: MALBIN
dialogues.text: Nice to know there are some things even Hitler can't destroy. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE BLUE Revision - 9-17-07 23.

dialogues.speaker: 40A CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Suddenly the camp grows quiet. TWO YOUNG MEN who have emerged from the forest, their clo dirty and torn. One of them aims an army-issue rifle.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: Hello, boys, what can we do for you?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: Food. We want food. Everyone remains still. Zus eyes his own rifle nearby.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: These little shits are holding us up. The Young Man motions his partner to take Zus's rifle.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You little shits have the balls to shoot me? In response, the young man CHAMBERS A ROUND.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: This is all the food we have. You are welcome to share.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: No. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YELLOW Revision - 7-30-07 23A.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I want to see if this little shit will shoot me. You like shooting Jews, you little shit?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: You are Jews? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GREEN Revision - 8-8-07 24.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: No. We're the Gestapo, you little shit.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Come. Sit. Put down your guns.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: Or perhaps you'd prefer I shove them up your ass.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Where are you from? The young man glares at Zus. Then, to Tuvia:

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: Horodyszcze. The name freezes Zus in his tracks. His wife is there.

dialogues.speaker: PERETZ
dialogues.text: We haven't eaten in two days. My name is Peretz, this is Jacov.

dialogues.speaker: JACOV
dialogues.text: Two days ago there were three thousand Jews in Horodyszcze. Now there are fifty. Me and him, we hid in a wall.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: You know a woman there, Sonia Bielski? The men look at one another.

dialogues.speaker: JACOV
dialogues.text: We knew her. Zus can hardly bring himself to ask the next question.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: ...There was a child. Jacov shakes his head. Sorry. Zus leans his head against a tree. After a moment he begi to BEAT HIS HEAD against it until BLOOD pours down his fa

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: (to the newcomers) His family. Tuvia puts his arms around his brother. Zus's shoulders begin to heave. Soon his body convulses with deep wrackin sobs. He is absolutely unself-conscious in his grief. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GREEN Revision - 8-8-07 25.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: So many dead.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: Mama. Papa. Their heads are close together, their faces wet with tear

dialogues.speaker: ZUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why not us?

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: I thought they'd be safe. I should have been with them.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: I could have protected them. Tuvia just holds him. He, too, is crying quietly.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Better to be rabbits? Hunted? Hiding? No... Zus breaks free of Tuvia's embrace and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Jacov and Peretz are eating. Between ravenous bites--

dialogues.speaker: PERETZ
dialogues.text: We are looking for partisans.

dialogues.speaker: JACOV
dialogues.text: What is the name of your otriad? Tuvia laughs ruefully.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: What is an 'otriad?'

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: An armed brigade.

dialogues.speaker: JACOV
dialogues.text: We heard the Russians are beginning to organize. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SALMON Revision - 8-19-07 26.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Here?

dialogues.speaker: JACOV
dialogues.text: And also in the Lipicanska.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: Then we are the Bielski Otriad. You want to join?

dialogues.speaker: PERETZ
dialogues.text: (looks around) The Russians are fighters.

dialogues.speaker: JACOV
dialogues.text: --But you need a gun to join them. Without a gun you are nothing. They sabotage railroads and kill Germans.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: We will kill all the Germans you can handle. Starting tonight. They stare up at him, his face a mask of blood and filth.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you're not afraid to use that rifle.

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Zus is loading Wilencki's gun.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: --we must get what we need without killing. We can't make more enemies-- Zus concentrates on opening the breach.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: --It won't bring your family back to life. Or Mama. Or Papa.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: Blood for blood. You had your revenge. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SALMON Revision - 8-19-07 27.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: And I can still see their faces.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: 'Vengeance is mine.' Who said that?

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: So this is God's work you're doing, Zussie?

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: No. Only YOU can play God. Save a few lives, take a few others...

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: We cannot become...like them.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: If only... (a hard look) Are you coming with us or not?

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Us?

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: Peretz and Jacov. (POINTEDLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asael, too. Tuvia looks over at Asael, who looks away.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: (to Zus) You are making the decisions now? A stand-off. Zus stares back at him. The struggle for command has grown more obvious.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We wait for dark.

dialogues.speaker: A BURNING TRUCK 43
dialogues.text: Lights up the night sky. A MAN comes running out of a tavern, the same man who loaded Jews onto trucks in an earlier scene.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: My truck! WHO DID THIS TO MY TRUCK? Tuvia, Zus and the others appear out the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: We did. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GREEN Revision - 8-8-07 28.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The man stops short at the sight of their weapons.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Who are you? (REALIZING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't understand. They made me give them my truck... Zus FIRES. Jacov and Peretz follow suit. The man goes down. They throw his DEAD BODY onto the burning truck.

dialogues.speaker: 43A A CLUSTER OF HOUSES
dialogues.text: Zus and Peretz are backing out of an open doorway, FIRING BACK INSIDE AS THEY GO. From within, the sound of SCREAMS

dialogues.speaker: COOPERATE WITH NAZI SCUM..
dialogues.text: FACES appear furtively at the windows of nearby houses. Zus addresses the little neighborhood, delirious with joy

dialogues.speaker: TELL THEM
dialogues.text: Tuvia looks around warily. This is getting out of hand.

dialogues.speaker: A ROADSIDE DITCH
dialogues.text: Tuvia and Asael lie in on one side of a road. Tuvia has looped ONE END OF THE WIRE around a post.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE DITCH ON THE OTHER SIDE 45
dialogues.text: Zus, Peretz, and Jacov WRAP THE WIRE to a tree.

dialogues.speaker: UP AHEAD 46
dialogues.text: The lights of a MOTORCYCLE, a GERMAN COURIER.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE DITCH 47
dialogues.text: Tuvia waits until the BIKE is almost upon them. Then he TIGHTENS the WIRE so it stretches INVISIBLY ACROSS THE RO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GOLDENROD Revision - 8-16-07 29.

dialogues.speaker: THE MOTORCYCLIST IS GARROTED 48
dialogues.text: by the wire. His bike goes sliding away as the Bielski's swarm him, KILLING HIM with the last bullet from the Mahkarov. ZUS rummages through the downed-bike's saddlebags. He fin a beautiful KNIFE and lifts it up triumphantly.

dialogues.speaker: PERETZ
dialogues.text: Look--! MORE HEADLIGHTS fast approaching.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Hide! Everyone! They all scramble back into the ditch, dragging the dead courier with them.

dialogues.speaker: A GERMAN STAFF CAR 49
dialogues.text: approaches. As its headlights pick up the downed motorcyc it slows and pulls off to the side --

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTLY OVER THE DITCH 50
dialogues.text: Where Tuvia and Zus are concealed. From within the car, w hear VOICES SPEAKING GERMAN. A YOUNG PRIVATE gets out and walks up the road to investigate.

dialogues.speaker: PRIVATE
dialogues.text: (in German; subtitled) It's one of ours, but no one is here. Maybe he was drunk? From the car, an SERGEANT yells a reply.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT
dialogues.text: (in German; subtitled) Move it off the road before the convoy passes. I'll report the sonuvabitch. As the soldier drags the bike off the road, AN OFFICER st out of the car and lights a cigarette. He's followed by the Sergeant. He carries a Schmeisser SUBMACHINE GUN dangling from his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE DITCH
dialogues.text: can see the Sergeant's feet peeking out over the ditch.

dialogues.speaker: A STREAM OF PISS
dialogues.text: Cascades onto him. He tries to inch his body away... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GOLDENROD Revision - 8-16-07 30.

dialogues.speaker: THE PISSING SERGEANT
dialogues.text: catches the flicker of MOVEMENT below, SEES Zus lying in the ditch. Stunned, he tries to zip up his fly. It catche ZUS LEAPS UP brandishing the KNIFE. He's on the Sergeant before he can get the gun off his shoulder. Stabbing him through his greatcoat, the BLADE BREAKS OFF IN HIS HAND. MEANWHILE, THE LIEUTENANT drops his cigarette, reaching under his coat for a pistol. Tuvia TACKLES him. The GUN skids away. They roll around on the road, CLAWING, PUNCHI BITING. Tuvia SLAMS the man's head against the pavement.

dialogues.speaker: UP THE ROAD 52
dialogues.text: The Private sees Asael and Peretz coming at him. Jacov follows with his rifle. The Private turns and runs down the road. They give chase.

dialogues.speaker: FROM INSIDE THE CAR 53
dialogues.text: Another OFFICER is in the back seat with A WOMAN. He reac for his gun, stands up in the seat and begins FIRING WILD at Tuvia. TUVIA ROLLS UNDER THE CAR, avoiding the burst. MEANWHILE, ZUS USES THE HANDLE OF THE KNIFE to BREAK the Sergeant's nose. He RIPS the SCHMEISSER away, firing poin blank into the man, whose greatcoat CATCHES FIRE.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE STAFF CAR
dialogues.text: The officer takes close aim at Tuvia, just as ZUS TURNS T MACHINE GUN on the car BLOWING OUT THE WINDOWS, killing t Officer and the woman -- and saving his brother's life.

dialogues.speaker: MEANWHILE, DOWN THE ROAD 54
dialogues.text: Jacov fires at the Private, MISSES. The man keeps RUNNING Jacov fires again. MISSES AGAIN. FINALLY his THIRD SHOT hits him in the leg. The Private keeps running. Limping now.

dialogues.speaker: JACOV
dialogues.text: I got him! Peretz and Asael can now catch up to the soldier.

dialogues.speaker: FROM FAR AWAY
dialogues.text: We SEE them knock the Private to the ground, KICKING him until Jacov catches up to them and FIRES A FINAL SHOT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GREEN Revision - 8-8-07 31.

dialogues.speaker: BACK AT THE STAFF CAR 55
dialogues.text: Tuvia stands, out of breath.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Stupid! The gunfire could be heard for miles.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: He was pissing on my head. Zus is high from the killing, covered in the dead man's blood. He begins calling out orders.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Peretz, Jacov, check the car for guns... (to Tuvia) This one's yours. He presents him with the Schmeisser as if it were a troph Tuvia accepts it, checking the gun efficiently.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'll check his pockets for more ammo.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Hurry--!

dialogues.speaker: AT THE STAFF CAR
dialogues.text: Peretz and Jacov emerge with two MACHINE-PISTOLS, several BOTTLES OF SCHNAPPS and a beautiful LEICA CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: JACOV
dialogues.text: They were on their way to a party! They toss one bottle to Zus and another to Tuvia.

dialogues.speaker: UP THE ROAD 56
dialogues.text: Asael stands over the dead Private. He isn't much older than Aron.

dialogues.speaker: BACK AT THE STAFF CAR 57
dialogues.text: ZUS rifles the pockets of the dead Sergeant for ammo. He finds cigarettes and the man's wallet. He opens it.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: Welcome to Belarus, herr Henkel. A CHAMPAGNE CORK POPS as Peretz and Jacov toast their victory.

dialogues.speaker: PERETZ
dialogues.text: Now we are real Partisans... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GOLDENROD Revision - 8-16-07 32.

dialogues.speaker: JACOV
dialogues.text: To the Bielski Otriad!

dialogues.speaker: SUDDENLY
dialogues.text: are rounding the bend. Troop trucks. The Staff Car was leading A CONVOY.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Into the fields! RUN! Tuvia pulls Peretz off the road, but Jacov reloads his ri and begins to FIRE at the approaching trucks.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jacov, NO! THE TRUCKS STOP. Troops pour off and begin RETURNING FIRE Jacov is CUT DOWN by a MACHINE GUN. Peretz, Zus, and Tuvia race into the WHEAT FIELD. It's no clear if they can make it into the woods. A FLARE IGNITES OVERHEAD turning the wheat fields BRIGHT WHITE in flicker incandescence. Malbin is almost paralytic with fear. ASAEL doesn't know which way to run. He plunges into the WHEAT FIELD...but ON THE WRONG SIDE OF THE ROAD. ONE OF THE TRUCKS drives forward, CUTTING HIM OFF, using its SPOTLIGHT to reveal him. FIFTEEN SOLDIERS start after him.

dialogues.speaker: SEEN FROM ABOVE 59
dialogues.text: We watch as they CONVERGE on him.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA, ZUS AND PERETZ
dialogues.text: Have almost made it into the woods when PERETZ IS HIT. He falls. Tuvia and Zus pick him up and half-carry, half-dra him into the sanctuary of the forest.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Zus. His rifle. Zus races back to pick up Peretz's weapon.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL, MEANWHILE 60
dialogues.text: has realized his mistake. He tries to circle back toward the woods but the SOLDIERS move to CUT HIM OFF. He is fas but not fast enough. We realize he isn't going to make it

dialogues.speaker: IN THE WOODS 61
dialogues.text: Tuvia and Zus look at the scene with mounting horror. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE PINK Revision - 9-27-07 33.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Asael... He rips the rifle from Zus's hands. For a moment we think he's going to go back after him. Instead, he wedges the rifle into a tree-trunk and takes careful aim...

dialogues.speaker: THE SPOTLIGHT SHATTERS
dialogues.text: Plunging the field into darkness as the flare burns out. ASAEL seizes the moment and dives to his knees, disappear from view and CRAWLING NOW rather than expose himself. AN IRRIGATION DITCH is nearby. Frantically he DIGS into the soft mud on its banks. As he scrapes his hands raw, h can HEAR his pursuers drawing near, CALLING OUT to one another.

dialogues.speaker: THE FOREST CAMP
dialogues.text: A somber mood. Tuvia watches someone scrape at the porrid congealed in an empty pot. OTHERS stare listlessly into space. ONE MAN chews on a piece of leather, ANOTHER sucks on an old chicken bone. Zus, meanwhile, is in the middle of a nasty drunk from th captured schnapps. Nearby, Aron shares his ration of brea with Rachel. Little enough, but a connection is made. Peretz lies nearby. Malbin is trying to comforts him. There is nothing that can help him. Malbin looks to Tuvia

dialogues.speaker: SHIMON
dialogues.text: They thought you were bringing food. Tuvia just stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did the farmers stop you? Still no answer from Tuvia.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They had guns? Dogs?

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMON
dialogues.text: I don't understand. Tuvia says nothing. Nearby, a child cries in hunger.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The Talmud says if you save a life you must take responsibility for it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE PINK Revision - 9-27-07 34-34A.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Again I have no idea what you are talking about. Around them, the beseeching eyes of so many hungry faces.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMON
dialogues.text: I think you do.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: You are the Bielski's? A MAN stands in the clearing. BEN ZION GULKOWITZ is tall, well muscled, a rifle strapped over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: How'd you get past the Lazar?

dialogues.speaker: BEN ZION
dialogues.text: Who? Zus stands unsteadily, then lurches into the woods, leani on an occasional tree for support. He finds the erstwhile sentry --LAZAR -- ambling toward him.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: You shit! You worthless shit! Zus punches him, knocking him the ground. In a sloppy, drunken frenzy, Zus SLAPS him again.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Enough!

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: He walked right by you! Someone could have been killed! Tuvia pulls Zus off him.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: I said, enough! (to Lazar) Get up! Get up!

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: If we were real partisans he'd be shot.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: He made a mistake! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE PINK Revision - 9-27-07 35.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: MISTAKE! We cannot make mistakes! As Zus goes for Lazar again, Tuvia roughly PULLS HIM OFF. Zus goes flying, tripping over, landing on his ass.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: That's right, Zus. No mistakes. Like last night. (looks at him) First they will torture Asael...and then they will hang him. Tuvia walks away, leaving his brother on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN CAMP 63
dialogues.text: Tuvia rejoins them. Ben Zion looks up at him.

dialogues.speaker: BEN ZION
dialogues.text: You are Tuvia Bielski.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: You know me?

dialogues.speaker: BEN ZION
dialogues.text: I am Ben Zion Gulkowitz. Ben Zion is besieged by questions about friends and famil

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: Pardon me, you are from Vilna. My sister lives on Passaya Street.

dialogues.speaker: BEN ZION
dialogues.text: The SD came without warning. Hundreds were taken. No one knows where. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE PINK Revision - 9-27-07 36.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: THE WOMAN begins to cry.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: My poor sister...dear God, no... Meanwhile, Peretz's MOANING ceases. A woman grumbles:

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: We'd be better off in the ghetto...

dialogues.speaker: TAMARA
dialogues.text: At least here we are safe.

dialogues.speaker: LOVA
dialogues.text: There at least we had hope...

dialogues.speaker: SHIMON
dialogues.text: No. Here, we have hope. A FEW MORE join in, grumbling their dissatisfaction. Othe take the opposite position. These are Jews, after all, an arguing is a revered sport and a pastime. It escalates.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: We are hungry! This is a defining moment for Tuvia. When at first he speaks, it is awkward, ineffectual amid the growing tumul

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: I know we have no food. But tomorrow... tomorrow will be another mission.

dialogues.speaker: RONA
dialogues.text: Look what happened the last time.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: That was a mistake! But the mistakes we made will not be made again! More objections. Tuvia must raise his voice to be heard.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We could be here a long time. And we have to prepare.

dialogues.speaker: LOVA
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Better security. Better at getting food and information-- (talking over their

dialogues.speaker: OBJECTIONS
dialogues.text: --at making shelters. Whatever is needed. We all participate. We don't work against each other. At this he looks directly at Zus. Daring him to object. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE PINK Revision - 9-27-07 36A.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I want to kill Nazis, too, but we...just...cannot afford revenge. Not right now. We cannot afford to lose friends like Jacov and Peretz. A small voice speaks up.

dialogues.speaker: ARON
dialogues.text: Or Asael. Everyone stares. It is the first time Aron has spoken. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE PINK Revision - 9-27-07 37.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Or Asael. We... We-- (trying to hold it

dialogues.speaker: TOGETHER
dialogues.text: --cannot lose anyone. He looks from face to face. Filthy, ravaged, many of them with tears in their eyes. This is what they need -- leadership, faith, something to believe in. And gradually, his tentativeness and awkwardness is repla by something else. A new voice. From deep inside.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...We will map out where we've been so as to not visit the same farms too often. And we take only from those who can afford to give, and leave those who can't alone.

dialogues.speaker: LOVA
dialogues.text: The poorest farmer has more than us.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: True. But what I am saying is... what I mean is... We are not thieves. (his resolve growing with every word) Or murderers. We may be hunted like animals but we will not become animals. (looks at them all) We have all chosen this -- to live free, like human beings, for as long as we can. Each day of freedom is an act of faith. And if we die trying to live, at least we die like human beings. His mission statement. A vision of their future. Everyone nods in mute acknowledgement. Zus lowers his hea The shift in power between them has occurred. Tuvia has emerged as the undisputed leader.

dialogues.speaker: 64A FALL IN THE FOREST 64A
dialogues.text: The trees take on color as if in celebration of their com together.

dialogues.speaker: KOSCIK'S FARM 65
dialogues.text: All is quiet as Tuvia, Zus and Ben Zion watch from the wo (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SALMON Revision - 8-19-07 38.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Now. They leave their cover and approach warily, guns at the ready.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE HOUSE 66
dialogues.text: Koscik's wife looks up from her garden and glares at them

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Hello. She refuses to be flattered. In Russian:

dialogues.speaker: KOSCIK'S WIFE
dialogues.text: In the barn.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BARN 67
dialogues.text: Zus calls out.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: Koscik, put your pants back on and leave those sheep alone. He steps into the shadows to find:

dialogues.speaker: KOSCIK HANGING FROM A THRESHING HOOK
dialogues.text: that has been driven through his chest. A sign attached t the hook reads (in Polish) "JEW LOVER."

dialogues.speaker: KOSCIK'S NEWLY-DUG GRAVE 68
dialogues.text: is just beyond the barn. Tuvia finishes piling on the las shovelful of earth. Koscik's wife stares straight ahead.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: KOSCIK'S WIFE
dialogues.text: (a monotone) Come.

dialogues.speaker: A ROOT CELLAR 69
dialogues.text: dug into a hillside. Overgrown with tall grass it is undetectable. Koscik's wife opens the heavy door, reveali ASAEL, who emerges blinking into the bright light.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Thank God. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE PINK Revision - 9-27-07 39.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Zus pulls his lost brother into a mighty embrace.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: Zus.... ZUSSIE... I can't breathe. Zus lets him go and Asael reaches back into the root cell

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look. Two LOVELY YOUNG WOMEN -- BELLA and CHAYA -- emerge, tentative and scared. Though their dresses are dirty, it obvious they were once expensive. Zus eyes them appreciatively.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: Asael... Well, well..

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: (BLUSHING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up. Look at this-- He has two more rifles and a large box of ammunition. Tuvia turns to Koscik's wife, deeply moved.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: KOSCIK'S WIFE
dialogues.text: (turning away) Go.

dialogues.speaker: A FOREST TRAIL 70
dialogues.text: They head for home. Zus walks beside Bella.

dialogues.speaker: BELLA
dialogues.text: --and then we fell into this horrible bog. Chaya saved me. Honestly, I can't swim at all. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE YELLOW Revision - 10-8-07 40.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: (MESMERIZED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I will teach you!

dialogues.speaker: BELLA
dialogues.text: We must have got lost a dozen times. I was absolutely resigned to die.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: BELLA
dialogues.text: Tell him, Chaya. Was it not the absolute worst? And that farmer, Mr. Koscik, kept making the most vulgar jokes, he said any girl who-- As they continue out of earshot, it appears as though Zus would be happy to listen for hours.

dialogues.speaker: A TOWERING PINE FOREST 71
dialogues.text: Aron and Rachel are walking through the woods. For a brie moment, viewed through the eyes of the young, we see thes woods as a magical place. Strange mushrooms, gnarled root an enormous spider's web glistening with dew.

dialogues.speaker: THE CAMP HAS BEGUN TO SHOW PROGRESS 72
dialogues.text: Sentries are posted. Zus expertly helps with the building a bunker ("zemylanka"). There's a more permanent kitchen, a wash trough, a clothesline. Pinchas tends his goat. Though primitive and raw...a haven.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMON AND MALBIN ARE DIGGING A HOLE
dialogues.text: Their bickering will become for them, as time goes on, a sport and a pastime.

dialogues.speaker: MALBIN
dialogues.text: You're trying to tell me all politics is meaningless.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMON
dialogues.text: In the West a monster with a little mustache, in the East a monster with a big mustache. This is all I need to know about politics.

dialogues.speaker: MALBIN
dialogues.text: Your messiah will have a mustache, too, and a full beard.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMON
dialogues.text: No. The messiahs are all in politics, and they're killing us. Zus unloads two cut and stripped trees. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE YELLOW Revision - 10-8-07 40A.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: What's killing me is all your talking. Back to work. Malbin and Shimon go back to work.

dialogues.speaker: MALBIN
dialogues.text: And Roosevelt? He has no mustache.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMON
dialogues.text: My life in these woods is much easier because of Mr. Roosevelt, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE YELLOW Revision - 10-8-07 41.

dialogues.speaker: WALKING THROUGH THE CAMP TUVIA AND ASAEL 73
dialogues.text: review their plans.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: We need to know what's going on in the villages, how the Germans patrol, who the informers are-- He realizes that Asael is not fully concentrating; instea he is watching as Chaya walks past.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you listening to me?

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: What's her name?

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: Chaya. [I believe.]

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: (YELLING)

dialogues.speaker: CHAYA
dialogues.text: He waves as Chaya turns to look in their direction. Asael smiles, embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So talk to her.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: I hardly know her.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: You spent three days in a cellar! Asael blushes, returns the focus to their prior conversat

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: Malbin says the Piznarksi granary is full. We need two guns at least...

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Whose turn to go?

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: Zus.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: You go along, just to make sure he understands my orders. Asael nods.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (re: Chaya) Go on...Go! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE YELLOW Revision - 10-8-07 A41-41A.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Asael heads toward Chaya.

dialogues.speaker: NEAR A SHED ROOF
dialogues.text: We notice a FEW NEW FACES. Their number has exceeded twen Among them are two lumbering, dark-skinned men, ARKADY an MOTL LUBCZANSKI. Ben Zion is showing Lazar and the other newcomers how to clean a weapon.

dialogues.speaker: BEN ZION
dialogues.text: This is not a gun. It is Bar Kochba's spear. It is Ehud's sword. You fix the patch to the rod-- They do as he instructs.

dialogues.speaker: BEN ZION, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: --then run it through the barrel... and don't lose the patch in the

dialogues.speaker: BARREL--
dialogues.text: Lazar looks up, sheepishly.

dialogues.speaker: LAZAR
dialogues.text: I lost my patch. ARKADY LUBCZANSKI whispers contemptuously to his brother, MOTL...

dialogues.speaker: ARKADY LUBCZANSKI
dialogues.text: The village idiot. Zus shoves Arkady out of the way and approaches Lazar, wh cowers. But rather than abuse him, Zus removes the patch from the rifle and hands it back to him.

dialogues.speaker: LAZAR
dialogues.text: Thank you, Zus.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: (returning the rifle) It's nothing. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE YELLOW Revision - 10-8-07 42.

dialogues.speaker: A ROADSIDE
dialogues.text: KISSELY is a MILKMAN with bright red hair and a bushy mustache. He leads a horse-drawn CART laden with milk can ZUS AND THE OTHERS rise up out of the ditch. In Russian:

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: (a pleasant tone) Good morning, friend. Getting an early start to market? Could you possibly spare us a bit of milk? Zus' tone is belied by the rifle in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: KISSELY
dialogues.text: This is what I'm required to give the Germans. If I don't meet my quota they'll shoot me and my family. Zus is tempted to shoot him himself.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: (to Zus) Leave half. He can't go to the Germans empty-handed. Zus glares at Asael.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tuvia's orders. Zus shakes his head, climbs onto the wagon and begins removing cartons. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE PINK Revision - 9-27-07 43.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: (to the milkman) We are so grateful, comrade, for your cooperation. What a lovely coat. Is that a fur collar?

dialogues.speaker: ZUS, NOW WEARING THE MILKMAN'S COAT 77
dialogues.text: joins the others lugging milk cans along the forest path.

dialogues.speaker: HALT
dialogues.text: Zus shakes his head. Lazar stands, pointing his weapon.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: Lazar, you can see it's us, you idiot. You only ask, 'who goes there' when you don't know who it is.

dialogues.speaker: LAZAR
dialogues.text: Sorry, Zus.

dialogues.speaker: THE CAMP 78
dialogues.text: is a beehive of activity. Shimon and Malbin are digging.

dialogues.speaker: MALBIN
dialogues.text: Even Spinoza said existence can be substantiated by empirical evidence.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMON
dialogues.text: All your secular learning, yet you know nothing of life.

dialogues.speaker: MALBIN
dialogues.text: How can you say this? Learning is my life.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMON
dialogues.text: And for every fact that goes in your head, another comes out your rear end. CHAYA and BELLA receive the bounty from the foragers.

dialogues.speaker: BELLA
dialogues.text: Milk, eggs -- Chaya, our brave men have brought us a feast!

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: Blintzes! You will make me blintzes! She bestows her best smile upon him.

dialogues.speaker: BY THE FIRE 79
dialogues.text: New arrivals are being shown around by Ben Zion. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHERRY Revision - 9-2-07 43A.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A MAN and WOMAN cry out with joy at an unexpected reunion (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE PINK Revision - 9-27-07 44.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ARKADY LUBCZANSKi approaches Chaya.

dialogues.speaker: ARKADY
dialogues.text: I don't think we've been properly introduced. Arkady Lubczanski.

dialogues.speaker: CHAYA
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: ARKADY
dialogues.text: You are Chaya?

dialogues.speaker: CHAYA
dialogues.text: ...Yes.

dialogues.speaker: ARKADY
dialogues.text: You are getting along all right? Anything you need? An extra blanket?

dialogues.speaker: CHAYA
dialogues.text: Oh. Well... Yes, that would be nice.

dialogues.speaker: ARKADY
dialogues.text: You'll have it by tonight. Something nice and soft. (smiles at her) I couldn't help but notice you don't have a husband yet.

dialogues.speaker: CHAYA
dialogues.text: (somewhat taken aback) Yet? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHERRY Revision - 9-2-07 44A.

dialogues.speaker: ARKADY
dialogues.text: Most of the woman have already chosen. They haven't told you about this? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE YELLOW Revision - 10-8-07 45.

dialogues.speaker: CHAYA
dialogues.text: No. But thank you for explaining it. She hurries away. Malbin sits down wearily beside Shimon.

dialogues.speaker: MALBIN
dialogues.text: Descartes at least provided for the subjective nature of experience. He takes a spoon from his sock.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMON
dialogues.text: Yes. You annoy me therefore I exist.

dialogues.speaker: MALBIN
dialogues.text: You are not eating?

dialogues.speaker: SHIMON
dialogues.text: By my best calculation, today is High Holiday. I am fasting. Malbin can't believe this. He rolls his eyes and digs in. One of the NEWCOMERS has brought a violin. He begins to play. A bittersweet melody. People stop talking and liste eyes filling at this reminder of a sweeter, civilized tim Ben Zion has left the new arrivals and approached Tuvia. He looks grave. Tuvia immediately knows something is wron

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: BEN ZION
dialogues.text: The new ones, they are from Novagroduk. Your wife-- Tuvia tenses. Ben Zion hesitates...

dialogues.speaker: BEN ZION, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They say...She was killed last week. (at a loss) I'm sorry. Tuvia nods. No outward display of grief. An awkward momen

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Thank you for telling me. (changes the subject) We have to dig a trench around the new zemylanka. If it rains I'm afraid water will seep in. Tuvia clearly cannot deal with his news.

dialogues.speaker: BEN ZION
dialogues.text: I'll see to it, then. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GOLDENROD Revision - 8-16-07 46.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Tuvia nods and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: ARON AND RACHEL WALK THROUGH THE WOODS
dialogues.text: Cathedral light cuts through the trees forming visible shafts.

dialogues.speaker: ARON
dialogues.text: Jacob's ladders. Like in his dream. Asael says you can see the angels. They walk on, eventually coming upon RAILROAD TRACKS. A TRAIN is rounding the bend, headed in their direction.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Can we stay to watch?

dialogues.speaker: ARON
dialogues.text: If we hide. They move back into the trees as the train NEARS: a slow- moving engine pulling a line of WOODEN CATTLE CARS.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Is that a Nazi train?

dialogues.speaker: ARON
dialogues.text: If we had some dynamite we could blow the shit out of it.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (with undisguised

dialogues.speaker: AWE
dialogues.text: ...Just like your brothers. Aron can't help but be pleased by this notion. Then, as the train passes, they can see HANDS gripping th small barred windows. And every now and then a gaunt, desperate FACE. They stare in astonishment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SALMON Revision - 8-19-07 47.

dialogues.speaker: 81A UNDER A SHELTER
dialogues.text: Tuvia sits alone. Outside, the SOUND of the violin continues. Shimon comes to sit beside him.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMON
dialogues.text: I am sorry for your loss. Tuvia nods. He is deep inside himself.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you want to say the Kaddish? When at last Tuvia speaks, it is almost to himself.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: She was a beautiful woman. But cold. Not a day went by she didn't remind me I wasn't a good provider. For years it wasn't really a marriage at all. And now... He lowers his head. All Shimon can do is sit beside him.

dialogues.speaker: THE PERIMETER OF THE CAMP
dialogues.text: Bella takes Chaya aside.

dialogues.speaker: BELLA
dialogues.text: You have lipstick? Please, I know you have some left. Chaya digs in her pocket and produces a tiny remnant. Bel dabs it on and casually approaches Zus, who is on guard duty.

dialogues.speaker: BELLA, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: May I join you?

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: BELLA
dialogues.text: You get lonely out here?

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: I like the woods. LAUGHTER and MUSIC waft through the trees.

dialogues.speaker: BELLA
dialogues.text: I'm a little scared out here. Zus knows an opportunity when he sees one. He offers her drink from his bottle of vodka. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GOLDENROD Revision - 8-16-07 48.

dialogues.speaker: BELLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I've never tried it.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: Go ahead. She drinks, refuses to grimace. Drinks again. Zus laughs. Bella touches the rifle in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: BELLA
dialogues.text: Why is there a rule against women having guns?

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: There aren't enough for the men.

dialogues.speaker: BELLA
dialogues.text: Women need guns, too.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: BELLA
dialogues.text: For protection.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: Women have men for protection. Bella bites her lip. She's a virgin but also realistic.

dialogues.speaker: BELLA
dialogues.text: I want protection. She steps closer and takes Zus's hand...under her coat... her breast...never taking her eyes off him.

dialogues.speaker: BELLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You will take good care of me? You will be my commander.

dialogues.speaker: MEANWHILE
dialogues.text: Aron and Rachel are walking back from the train tracks. Suddenly he senses movement, freezes: ARMED POLICEMEN are advancing through the trees. Aron and Rachel bury themselves beneath piles of leaves until the police pass by, then he grabs her hand and dash

dialogues.speaker: OFF--
dialogues.text: ARON RUNS through the woods like a deer. She follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE YELLOW Revision - 10-8-07 49.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CAMP 85
dialogues.text: He bursts in, SCREAMING.

dialogues.speaker: MEN WITH GUNS
dialogues.text: Chaos. People panic, search for family members, grab whatever th can carry, ZUS AND BELLA emerge from the woods where they have lain together for the first time. He grabs his rifle. TUVIA tries to maintain order.

dialogues.speaker: ONLY FOOD AND GUNS
dialogues.text: Asael clutches Chaya's hand. Rounding up others.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: Don't panic. THIS WAY!. GO.

dialogues.speaker: QUIET
dialogues.text: THE POLICEMEN begin FIRING. TWO of the group are KILLED. Tuvia roughly pushes people deeper into the woods.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Lova, Ben Zion -- stay with us. Asael, keep them moving. Don't stop! THE POLICEMEN enter the camp. A submachine gun RAKES a shelter. KISSELY has found the escape trail into the wood

dialogues.speaker: KISSELY
dialogues.text: This way--

dialogues.speaker: THE FOREST IS DEATHLY STILL 86
dialogues.text: Tuvia and Zus usher the group across the river and up the embankment.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Go! Go! Move! (holding back) Isaac, keep them moving! Zus, Asael, Ben Zion... Tuvia motions for them to take defensive positions while the others escape.- The policemen emerge hurriedly through the trees and begi crossing the river. SHOTS rings out. A Policeman goes down. The German Soldie is shot in the leg. They are dragged from the water. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE YELLOW Revision - 10-8-07 49A.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: An edgy silence. From the trees a VOICE calls out in Russ (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE YELLOW Revision - 10-8-07 50.

dialogues.speaker: THE FOOL
dialogues.text: The policemen exchange apprehensive looks.

dialogues.speaker: KARELITZ
dialogues.text: The confrontation changes languages.

dialogues.speaker: YOU FIRST
dialogues.text: Derisive laughter from the trees.

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN
dialogues.text: Give us Bielski and the rest of you can go free! Behind a tree, Tuvia is surprised by the mention of his name.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: You are from Belarussia, pig! Why do you work for the Germans against your own people?

dialogues.speaker: KISSELY
dialogues.text: For the same reason you steal from the poor. To survive. ANOTHER SHOT RINGS OUT. Kessely is hit in the arm.

dialogues.speaker: KISSELY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: Next one is to the head! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE YELLOW Revision - 10-8-07 51.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Soon it will be dark... See how you find your way home then! The policemen are having similar thoughts.

dialogues.speaker: SUDDENLY
dialogues.text: Soon it's a full-scale retreat.

dialogues.speaker: AFTER A MOMENT
dialogues.text: Tuvia, Zus, Lova & Ben Zion emerge. Zus picks up the German's machine pistol.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They'll be back. (looks around) We have to find a new camp.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: Next time just draw them a map.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: It means -- we should have killed the fucking milkman. Your policy of diplomacy is shit. Zus is breathing hard, full of the adrenaline of battle.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...Two are dead. Winter is coming and now we have no shelter. Why? Because you don't have the stomach to do what must be done. He walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE YELLOW Revision - 10-8-07 52.

dialogues.speaker: THE NOVEMBER WIND WHISTLES THROUGH THE BARE FOREST
dialogues.text: as the group trudges along -- weighed down by cooking gea food, guns, etc. Asael takes the iron cauldron from Chaya Zus and Bella walk side-by-side. Pinchas leads his goat.

dialogues.speaker: MALBIN
dialogues.text: Where is he taking us? My feet are going to fall off.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMON
dialogues.text: A great rabbi once said, "wherever I go, I am always going to the land of Israel."

dialogues.speaker: MALBIN
dialogues.text: Well, maybe rabbis should give better directions. Tuvia walks alongside but apart.

dialogues.speaker: A HILLSIDE 89
dialogues.text: The group is sprawled on the ground. Four people share a single cigarette. Shimon and Malbin hardly have the energ to argue. Pinchas feeds his goat. Tuvia walks among them.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Rest and eat. I need volunteers for a scouting party. Zus raises his hand. Tuvia nods in grudging gratitude. However mixed his feelings, Zus can always be counted on.

dialogues.speaker: A FORK IN THE TRAIL 90
dialogues.text: Tuvia looks at Zus, who shrugs. They are in unfamiliar territory. As they move cautiously forward:

dialogues.speaker: A MAN IN A RED ARMY TUNIC
dialogues.text: steps into the path, holding an automatic rifle. He WHIST softly. More ARMED MEN materialize, surrounding them.

dialogues.speaker: GRAMOV
dialogues.text: (in Russian; subtitles)

dialogues.speaker: WHO ARE YOU
dialogues.text: Tuvia instantly grasps the situation. He salutes.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: (in Russian; subtitles) A brigade of independent fighters searching for our comrades. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHERRY Revision - 9-2-07 52A.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Zus almost does a double-take at Tuvia's bluff.

dialogues.speaker: GRAMOV
dialogues.text: What brigade? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YELLOW Revision - 7-30-07 53.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: We belong to the Bielski otriad.

dialogues.speaker: GRAMOV
dialogues.text: We know of you. Jewish bandits. Zus's finger tightens on the trigger of his submachine gu

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: I'll take the two on the left... Tuvia maintains his composure.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: I'm sure we can clear up this misunderstanding with your commander.

dialogues.speaker: THE OCTOBER OTRIAD BASE 91
dialogues.text: A primitive tent camp. RUSSIAN PARTISANS move about, quie and cold-eyed men wearing remnants of Red Army uniforms. Zus can't help but be impressed by the array of weaponry. VICTOR PACHENKO emerges from a tent. A former lieutenant, dashing in a fur cap and long officer's coat. He addresse them in Russian.

dialogues.speaker: VIKTOR
