dialogues.text: I am Viktor Panchenko, commander of the October otriad. We have had complaints of a Jewish gang stealing from villages loyal to us. (a steely look) How do you respond to these charges?

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: When you take food it is from loyal supporters. When we do, you call it stealing.

dialogues.speaker: VIKTOR
dialogues.text: We are soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: And we fight a common enemy. The motherland doesn't distinguish between Jews and non-Jews. Viktor is amused by this bit of Soviet dogma.

dialogues.speaker: VIKTOR
dialogues.text: But Jews do not fight. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE GREEN Revision - 10-14-07 54.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: These Jews do. Viktor appraises Tuvia for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: VIKTOR
dialogues.text: We will see. Select your best fighters and send them to us. Zus looks at Tuvia, knowing he has no choice.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: We are honored to be of service. Tuvia and Zus SALUTE and head back the way they came.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: (under his breath) So we're partisans now.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: As if we have a choice.

dialogues.speaker: 91A NEW CAMP
dialogues.text: Has taken root. People hard at work building zemylanka.

dialogues.speaker: THE NEW CAMP
dialogues.text: Tuvia and Malbin are working together on a new bunker. Malbin expertly nails a header across a doorway.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: (throwing a smaller

dialogues.speaker: HAMMER
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: MALBIN
dialogues.text: If my friends at The New Socialists' Club could see me now... (shakes his head) I haven't read a book in months.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: I haven't read one in years. Malbin looks up from his work.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I wasn't a very good student. You can ask Shimon.

dialogues.speaker: MALBIN
dialogues.text: .I did. Tuvia laughs ruefully. Considers him for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Yet you accept me as Commander. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE GOLDENROD Revision - 10-21-07 55.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Malbin thinks about it for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: MALBIN
dialogues.text: Who else? Tuvia nods. Good point. They continue working.

dialogues.speaker: MALBIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Might I make an observation? Tuvia gestures, go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: MALBIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We need to be strong, but--

dialogues.speaker: MALBIN
dialogues.text: Other things are important, too.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Such as? Malbin tries to think how best to put it.

dialogues.speaker: MALBIN
dialogues.text: Community. Tuvia considers the word. As if trying it on for size.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: You have more ideas? About all this?

dialogues.speaker: MALBIN
dialogues.text: ...A few.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: I'm listening...

dialogues.speaker: BELLA
dialogues.text: More mouths to feed.

dialogues.speaker: RONA
dialogues.text: More young bodies to keep us warm. One ot them, a young man, YITZHAK SHULMAN, RIPS the yello Star-of-David off his coat and kneels to KISS THE GROUND.

dialogues.speaker: SHULMAN
dialogues.text: Which one is Tuvia Bielski? Someone points Tuvia out. Shulman hurries over and kisses Tuvia's hand. Zus is drinking nearby with his cronies. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE GOLDENROD Revision - 10-21-07 55A.

dialogues.speaker: SHULMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: None of us knew if you really existed. I am from Baranowicze. They are going to liquidate the ghetto. Chaya bursts into tears. Asael puts his arm around her.

dialogues.speaker: CHAYA
dialogues.text: My parents-- Zus catches Tuvia's glance to Malbin. Tuvia turns back to Shulman.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: We'll do what we can. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE GOLDENROD Revision - 10-21-07 56.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Shulman tries to kiss Tuvia's hand once again, but Tuvia takes his hand, instead, and shakes it. CHAYA looks deeply into Asael's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: CHAYA
dialogues.text: You will help my parents?

dialogues.speaker: CHAYA
dialogues.text: I've seen you looking at me. If you were to rescue them, I would do... anything...you-- Asael is completely undone by the starkness of this.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: No. I mean, yes. All right.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS CATCHES UP TO TUVIA 94
dialogues.text: and grabs him as he walks away. Their hushed tones belie the growing chasm between them. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GREEN Revision - 8-8-07 57.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: And what exactly does that mean, 'do what we can.'

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: We must send for whoever is left alive.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: And if it is a hundred? Six hundred?

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Then we will provide.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: And when the Germans follow these hundreds and slaughter us.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: I won't let that happen. Tuvia exchanges a glance with Malbin. Zus catches it. He has sensed Malbin's growing influence.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: You won't let that happen.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: No. I'll bring them out myself.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: From the ghetto.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: Pan Tuvia. Rabbi Tuvia. Allow me to kiss your hand... Tuvia tries to pull his hand away, but Zus holds him.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You think Pachenko wants hundreds more of us in the forest?

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: I cannot have you contradicting me... Not when others are around. (looks around) Our family must stick together. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TAN Revision - 9-10-07 58.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: And who is it that's risking our family, and for what? For the sake of these-- (gestures at the new

dialogues.speaker: ARRIVALS
dialogues.text: --Malbushim.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Don't call them that.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: That's who comes to us from the ghetto. Empty clothes. Bloodsuckers.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: They are people. Jews.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: Pretentious Jews. Jews who stuck up their noses and wouldn't give us the time of day when we passed them on the street. Jews who went out of their way to keep their daughters locked away from our dirty hands. (SAVAGELY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think your old teacher will give you a good grade because you saved his worthless ass! They accept you as their leader only because they are too weak and full of shit to help themselves.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: --What about Bella? Tuvia looks over at Bella, who is anxiously watching.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: --You think she'd be with you if it wasn't for what is happening here? Zus glares at him, but tries to control himself.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: --Is it love Zus? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE SALMON Revision - 10-21-07 59.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Zus is sick of talk. He PUNCHES Tuvia in the face. Tuvia is rocked but still he goads his brother.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You are the man of her dreams? The Romeo of Novagrudok? Zus can't take anymore. He charges Tuvia, who sidesteps and SLAMS him in the gut. All the frustration of the past months, not to mention years of sibling rivalry, translat into fists and elbows. Ben Zion moves to break it up. Tuvia and Zus turn on him.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: Is this your business? Zus gains the upper hand and starts to beat the crap put Tuvia. Finally, in desperation Tuvia rolls away and picks up a rock. He is about to slam it into his brother's head when suddenly he stops himself. The two brothers look at each other, both breathing heavi realizing that they have crossed some line.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (calls out) Ben Zion. Krensky. Lova. Israel. Let's go. (to Tuvia) We are going to join the real partisans. He looks at Asael.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you coming? Asael looks at one brother, then the other. Once again, h is in the middle. He looks at Chaya, then back at Zus.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: Good. I'll dance at your wedding. He stops by Bella's side, touches her arm, then disappear down the trail. The others follow.

dialogues.speaker: THE OUTSKIRTS OF NOVOGRUDOK 95
dialogues.text: Tuvia and Asael feel naked outside the safety of the fore In the distance the city looms.

dialogues.speaker: 95A THE STREETS OF NOVOGRUDOK 95A
dialogues.text: Tuvia and Asael pass by the barbed wire and machine-guns the guards and dogs manning the barrier to the ghetto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GOLDENROD Revision - 8-16-07 59A.

dialogues.speaker: THE WALLS OF THE NOVOGRUDOK GHETTO 96
dialogues.text: Tuvia and Asael climb over a dilapidated wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE YELLOW Revision - 10-8-07 60.

dialogues.speaker: THE DESERTED STREETS OF THE GHETTO 97
dialogues.text: People peer out from behind shuttered windows. Others hur to get off the street. Tuvia consults a hand-drawn map.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: This way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zus, Lova and Ben Zion march alongside the Russians Partisans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE YELLOW Revision - 10-8-07 61.

dialogues.speaker: AN APARTMENT IN THE GHETTO
dialogues.text: that might once have been home to a family-of-four now HO fifteen. Tuvia and Asael are deep in conversation with several ELDERS of the ghetto Council

dialogues.speaker: ELDER
dialogues.text: We are not so naive as to believe they won't kill some of us. But all the Jews? It makes no sense. They need us to work. In the factories. The labor camps. Tuvia notices A PRETTY GIRL standing on a chair in order hear. Her name is LILKA and we will soon come to know her (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YELLOW Revision - 7-30-07 62.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: There are rumors. Of death camps.

dialogues.speaker: ELDER
dialogues.text: We too have heard of such places. But have you seen them yourself? Can you tell me, with absolute certainty, that we are not just as likely to die out there with you in the woods with Winter coming on...? Someone WHISTLES from the street below. A tense moment. Another whistle. All clear.

dialogues.speaker: ELDER
dialogues.text: --Do you think we haven't all considered running away? For every one that leaves they kill twenty. How can I sacrifice thousands for the sake of a few?" Tuvia looks at them, rubbing his face in concentration.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: What if we were to take all of you?

dialogues.speaker: ELDER
dialogues.text: The old, the sick? There are thousands. How will we live?

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: We will protect you. We have made alliances with the Russian Partisans.

dialogues.speaker: ELDER
dialogues.text: They are as bad as the Nazi's. You are too young to know the pogroms-- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE GREEN Revision - 10-14-07 63-63A.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Tuvia SLAMS HIS FIST on a table.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: YOU WANT TIME? Fine, I give you a day. A month. Maybe a year. To live! (to an older couple) Your daughter is out there with us. (to another woman) Your husband is waiting for you. An old orthodox RABBI stands nearby.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Rabbi?

dialogues.speaker: RABBI
dialogues.text: We...are waiting for God. Tuvia looks at him in disbelief. Such madness is incontrovertible. A suspended moment.

dialogues.speaker: LILKA
dialogues.text: I am going. This breaks the log jam. Several others join in, "We are coming," "Us, too," etc. Tuvia nods his acknowledgment.

dialogues.speaker: A COURTYARD IN THE NOVOGRUDOK GHETTO
dialogues.text: A crude tunnel has been dug through a ghetto wall. PEOPLE squeeze through into the adjoining alley. Behind them, a hundred more await their turn. Out in the alley, Asael stops them momentarily as a car goes by at the end of the street, then gives the all-clea Tuvia takes Lilka' hand and helps her pass through. Their eyes meet for just a moment.

dialogues.speaker: 100A OMITTED 100A
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE GOLDENROD Revision - 10-21-07 63B-63C.

dialogues.speaker: THE FOREST CAMP 101
dialogues.text: The new ARRIVALS file in. Men wear citified coats and som women have furs. They eye the veterans, thinking, 'how dirty they are'; the veterans eye them warily, wondering, 'How will we feed them?' A handmade sign reads, "New Jerusalem." Chaya is re-unite with her parents. She holds Asael's arm and looks up at him with absolute rapture. She is his. Malbin is collecting valuables. One WELL-DRESSED WOMAN is reluctant to part with her jewelry.

dialogues.speaker: WELL-DRESSED WOMAN
dialogues.text: But they were my grandmother's... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GOLDENROD Revision - 8-16-07 64.

dialogues.speaker: MALBIN
dialogues.text: And now they belong to the otriad. Everyone sacrifices for the sake of the collective. We can trade these for food or weapons. Next... Nearby, Shimon is INTERVIEWING another line of arrivals.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMON
dialogues.text: --How about carpenters? Any bootmakers? Seamstresses?

dialogues.speaker: ARRIVAL
dialogues.text: I am an accountant.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMON
dialogues.text: (DEADPAN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That should come in handy. Next...

dialogues.speaker: RIVA
dialogues.text: I am a nurse.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMON
dialogues.text: Ahhh...welcome. And you, tateh? OPPENHEIM is an old man with thick glasses.

dialogues.speaker: OPPENHEIM
dialogues.text: I am a watchmaker. Tuvia has walked over to observe.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Can you repair guns?

dialogues.speaker: OPPENHEIM
dialogues.text: Guns? No.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: (hands him a rifle) See if you can fix this trigger. Oppenheim slips on a pair of spectacles and studies the mechanism. It sticks. He digs into his pocket and produce a small file and expertly begins to shave the metal spur. He tests it, then hands it back to Tuvia, who CLICKS the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You have a new profession. A murmur of appreciation ripples through the group as Shu appears -- leading A MAGNIFICENT WHITE HORSE. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE GOLDENROD Revision - 10-21-07 65.

dialogues.speaker: SHULMAN
dialogues.text: Look what we found running free. Must have belonged to an aristocrat.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: My God, she's beautiful. (strokes her flanks) May I? He mounts her easily, urges her around the perimeter, greeting the new arrivals. Heads turn as he trots past. He is the center of attention, and he knows it. And likes it.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Friends, we are happy to see you safely among us. But there are many things you must learn about living here... All attention turns to him. The Lubczanski brothers grumb to each other, none too pleased with Tuvia's show-boating

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Once you are settled, you'll be assigned work duties. Everyone works, no exceptions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of people being introduced to various tasks: shoemaking, sewing, cooking. Asael teaching them to use guns.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: We will help supply the Russian Partisans by making clothes, repairing guns.

dialogues.speaker: 101B BACK TO TUVIA ON HORSEBACK 101B
dialogues.text: Malbin catches his eye and winks -- clearly this has been part of their "strategy" discussions.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Women will learn to use weapons and fight alongside men. Tuvia takes a rifle from Asael and holds it aloft.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is not a gun. It is Bar Kochba's spear. It is Ehud's sword. You will all learn to protect yourselves. A LITTLE BOY holds Lilka's hand and looks up at Tuvia in wonder. He cuts an iconic figure. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE GOLDENROD Revision - 10-21-07 65A.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE BOY
dialogues.text: (to Lilka) He is a Jew? Lilka is equally struck -- although there is something mo than wonder in her regard. She nods.

dialogues.speaker: TUVU
dialogues.text: Pregnancies are forbidden. We cannot accommodate an infant's needs. Our bunkers are overcrowded so you will have to build new ones. He looks out over the sea of expectant faces.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: (CONTINUING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...This is the one place in all of Belorussia where a Jew can be free. (looks out over them) We will make again, here in this forest, the life that was taken from you. We welcome you into our community.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE YELLOW Revision - 10-8-07 66.

dialogues.speaker: 101C LATER
dialogues.text: when Riva stops him.

dialogues.speaker: RIVA
dialogues.text: You are Tuvia Bielski? You are really him? (Tuvia nods

dialogues.speaker: TENTATIVELY
dialogues.text: You are a hero. A Maccabee. She vigorously shakes Tuvia's hand and walks away. Tuvia catches his reflection in the water. And likes it.

dialogues.speaker: 102A IN AN UNDERGROUND BUNKER
dialogues.text: Lilka awakens to find TEN WOMEN wedged in beside her -- back to front -- like spoons. Idly, she begins to ITCH her scalp. Then her leg. In the pale morning light she sees that she is crawling with lic She SCREAMS. The women around her wake up, terrified.

dialogues.speaker: LILKA
dialogues.text: Get them off! Get them off me!

dialogues.speaker: CHAYA
dialogues.text: What? Where?

dialogues.speaker: RIVA
dialogues.text: Lice need somewhere to sleep, too. The others LAUGH, but Lilka is on the verge of hysteria. She stumbles out, stepping on several others as she goes.

dialogues.speaker: 102B OUTSIDE THE BUNKER 102B
dialogues.text: Crying, she tears at her clothes -- only to discover Tuvi and OTHERS staring at her with interest. She is mortified

dialogues.speaker: 102C LATER THAT DAY 102C
dialogues.text: THE WOMEN wash clothes in the stream. Lilka is by the riverbank, scrubbing furiously. Tamara works beside her.

dialogues.speaker: TAMARA
dialogues.text: You get rid of them quicker if you boil them. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHERRY Revision - 9-2-07 66A.

dialogues.speaker: 102C CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Lilka is grateful for this bit of camp wisdom.

dialogues.speaker: BELLA
dialogues.text: Tamara, come on in, it's freezing and slimy and horrible. Tamara shakes her head, no.

dialogues.speaker: RIVA
dialogues.text: So modest...

dialogues.speaker: BELLA
dialogues.text: ... So last night I dreamed I was taking a real bath. With hot water.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: And soap. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YELLOW Revision - 7-30-07 66B.

dialogues.speaker: RIVA
dialogues.text: And bubbles.

dialogues.speaker: CHAYA
dialogues.text: Oh, take me to that dream!

dialogues.speaker: RIVA
dialogues.text: I was dreaming of shoes...

dialogues.speaker: CHAYA
dialogues.text: Shoes, Riva?

dialogues.speaker: RIVA
dialogues.text: There was a man in a shop on Grudek street... and the way he caressed my feet when I tried on his shoes... Riva swoons. The women burst into ribald laughter. The SOUND of a horse. They look to the opposite bank where: TUVIA RIDES BY on his horse. Lilka can't help but stare.

dialogues.speaker: BELLA
dialogues.text: Doesn't take a fortune teller to know what Lilka's dreaming about... Lilka blushes furiously. The women laugh even louder.

dialogues.speaker: A FLAT STRETCH OF TRAIN TRACK 103
dialogues.text: Gramov shows Zus how to plant a disk-like CONTACT MINE.

dialogues.speaker: GRAMOV
dialogues.text: --buried underneath with this

dialogues.speaker: DETONATOR--
dialogues.text: (indicates a finger- like protrusion) --almost touching the rail. As the train passes, its weight causes pressure on the detonator, and then-- (very loud; in English)

dialogues.speaker: BOOM
dialogues.text: Zus falls over, startled. Gramov laughs. Partisan humor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE YELLOW Revision - 10-8-07 67.

dialogues.speaker: FOREST CAMP
dialogues.text: Chaya is on kitchen detail with Tamara.

dialogues.speaker: TAMARA
dialogues.text: Yesterday, potatoes with beets, Today, beets with potatoes. Special treat tomorrow...potato soup. With beets. Not far away, Arkady and several others have created a primitive still -- turning potatoes into vodka.

dialogues.speaker: ARKADY
dialogues.text: We love potatoes, don't we, boys! Here, put some hair on your chest! They give Aron his first taste.

dialogues.speaker: NEARBY
dialogues.text: Bella is walking, arm in arm, with Asael.

dialogues.speaker: BELLA
dialogues.text: So...a little bird told me that a certain someone is waiting...for another certain someone to ask a certain question... Go on... She indicates Chaya by wiggling her eyebrows in her direction. Asael shakes his head but heads in that direction.

dialogues.speaker: 104A NEARBY 104A
dialogues.text: Asael "happens" to bump into Chaya.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: Hello, Chaya.

dialogues.speaker: CHAYA
dialogues.text: Hello, Asael.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: May...I help you?

dialogues.speaker: CHAYA
dialogues.text: Wash clothes? I... don't think so. An awkward moment as he stands there watching her.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: Chaya... I...was...wondering...if... maybe...you...I mean... you and I-- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE GREEN Revision - 10-14-07 67A.

dialogues.speaker: CHAYA
dialogues.text: I accept.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: You do?

dialogues.speaker: CHAYA
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: 104B ANOTHER DAY 104B
dialogues.text: Asael and Chaya are getting married. A LIGHT SNOW is fall as they say repeat their vows as Shimon instructs. Their breath condenses in the cold.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: Behold thou art consecrated unto me by this ring according to the Laws of Moses and Israel. But rather than a ring, Asael gives her a shiny new rifle As the ceremony continues, we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zus, Ben Zion and several BIELSKI FIGHTERS hide alongside TEN RUSSIAN PARTISANS as a GERMAN TROOP TRUCK approaches. Pachenko watches as Zus follows the approaching truck thr binoculars, then cocks the heavy machine gun. The truck SLOWS TO A CRAWL as it encounters an overturned PEASANT CART blocking the road.

dialogues.speaker: 104D BACK TO THE WEDDING 104D
dialogues.text: As Asael kisses the bride, Tuvia is staring not at the newlyweds but rather at Lilka, who has washed and let dow her hair. She glances up and meets his eye, then looks away. As Asael crushes the traditional glass underfoot:

dialogues.speaker: 104E ZUS OPENS FIRE. 104E
dialogues.text: The driver SLUMPS over the wheel and the truck careens la off the road. GERMAN SOLDIERS spill out, blindly returning fire as Zus' fighters SWARM down the hill. Several are HIT right away.

dialogues.speaker: WITH THE FRENZY OF BATTLE.
dialogues.text: People dance and sing, their joy juxtaposed with the murderous intensity of the firefight, their twirling movements a cracked mirror of the death agonies of fighte of both sides as they are hit and fall. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE SALMON Revision - 10-21-07 67B.

dialogues.speaker: 104F CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Some of the inexperienced Jewish fighters freeze, some fi their weapons blindly. Ben Zion does well. ZUS RUNS AMONG THEM, fiercely EXHORTING them to attack.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: Get up! Move! SHOOT OR I'LL SHOOT YOU...

dialogues.speaker: FROM A VANTAGE POINT IN THE ROCKS
dialogues.text: Viktor watches, heartened by Zus' natural aggression. GERMAN SOLDIERS TAKE COVER behind the overturned truck effectively RETURNING FIRE. Several partisans are KILLED. ZUS PULLS A POTATO MASHER GRENADE from his belt and RUNS THE TRUCK in a mad headlong assault.

dialogues.speaker: ARRRRGGGHHHHHHHHHHHHH
dialogues.text: He ROLLS THE GRENADE under the truck and dives away as it EXPLODES. The remaining Germans RAISE THEIR HANDS. CHEERING PARTISANS leap into the truck, capturing an arse of rifles and ammo. THE JEWISH FIGHTERS join in the looti Boots, coats, blankets, etc. Zus approaches the wounded and captured German prisoners, kneeling in surrender, hands behind their necks. Without hesitation, he shoots them, point-blank, one afte another. VIKTOR approaches Zus, who salutes.

dialogues.speaker: VIKTOR
dialogues.text: You are related to Bielski?

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: I am a Bielski, too. Viktor looks at him appraisingly.

dialogues.speaker: VIKTOR
dialogues.text: Indeed. He walks away. Zus has found a home.

dialogues.speaker: 104G LATER
dialogues.text: as SNOW continues to fall. The young marriage is a celebration of hope over despair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE SALMON Revision - 10-21-07 68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE SALMON Revision - 10-21-07 69.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE CHERRY Revision - 11-1-07 70.

dialogues.speaker: THE RUSSIAN WINTER, (MONTAGE- MUSIC OVER)
dialogues.text: SNOW covers the camp. A driving wind. Bundled in scarves, overcoats and as many layers as they can wear, Bella and Chaya break ice in a pot. Tamara takes FROZEN LAUNDRY fro a line. In a bunker, Malbin and Shimon shiver under a shared blan Women and children stare blankly into space. Riva unwraps rags from a man's foot and examines his toes BLACK with frostbite. Asael and Tuvia are making their rounds. They pass Aron and Rachel who have built a snowman which they top off by adding a German helmet with a bullet hole in it.

dialogues.speaker: 109A IN A STORAGE AREA 109A
dialogues.text: Asael shows Tuvia the last few potatoes.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: There is talk of returning to the  ghetto.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Madness.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: They've barely eaten in days. Even when our food missions manage to get through, there are armed patrols. Farmers who once helped us now guard their barns with shotguns. Tuvia considers for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Send out more missions. And bring shotguns. Tuvia sets off. In every face he passes, there's misery and accusation in the shivering bodies and trembling blue lips. Children stare at him with sunken, haunted eyes.

dialogues.speaker: 109AA A MAKESHIFT STABLE 109AA
dialogues.text: Tuvia visits his beautiful horse. He unties him.

dialogues.speaker: 109AB LATER
dialogues.text: A whisper runs through the group..."meat"..."what kind?". Where'd it come from?" Tuvia watches them eat hungrily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE SALMON Revision - 10-21-07 71.

dialogues.speaker: 109E A STABLE
dialogues.text: Snow falling outside. Several partisans are singing. Zus is drinking heavily with Viktor; they take pinches of sal with each swallow. Viktor finishes a bottle, tosses it.

dialogues.speaker: VIKTOR
dialogues.text: Another dead soldier! Zus looks at him, bleary-eyed, confused. Viktor explains:

dialogues.speaker: VIKTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: More dead soldiers than empty bottles.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: (slurring his words) That is so...Russian. He cracks open another bottle and takes a big slug.

dialogues.speaker: VIKTOR
dialogues.text: At least you drink like one.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: 'A Jew can't drink, a Jew can't fight.' What is it we are good at, Viktor? Dying. That is what we are good at.

dialogues.speaker: VIKTOR
dialogues.text: So tell me about this brother of yours...

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: .Asael?

dialogues.speaker: VIKTOR
dialogues.text: You are such an idiot. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE CHERRY Revision - 11-1-07 71A.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: I know who you mean... The Great Tuvia Bielski. Savior of the Jews and all around Big Shit.

dialogues.speaker: VIKTOR
dialogues.text: You compete with him.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: He competes with me.

dialogues.speaker: VIKTOR
dialogues.text: My older brother and I have the same relationship.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: He is a Big Shit also?

dialogues.speaker: VIKTOR
dialogues.text: A soldier. (a long moment) He was killed in the first hour of the German invasion. This sobers them up a bit.

dialogues.speaker: 109F IN THE ZEMYLANKA 109F
dialogues.text: LILKA is shivering, her eyes inward and unfocused.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Lilka?

dialogues.speaker: LILKA
dialogues.text: Sorry, Tuvia. I was...thinking. It's nothing. He looks at her intently, knowing there's more.

dialogues.speaker: LILKA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...Every time new people come into camp, I keep hoping... even though, I know... (her teeth are

dialogues.speaker: CHATTERING
dialogues.text: ...I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Everyone here has lost someone. She looks up at him, helpless to be so revealed.

dialogues.speaker: LILKA
dialogues.text: You too?

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: (a small nod) Here... He takes off his wool coat and puts it around her shoulde (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE GOLDENROD Revision - 10-21-07 71B.

dialogues.speaker: LILKA
dialogues.text: No. Today I go on my first food mission. Tuvia's order has consigned her to this dangerous duty.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: I will have Asael send someone else.

dialogues.speaker: LILKA
dialogues.text: No. I must go now. I want to go. She is clearly scared but desperate not to show it. He reaches into his belt and hands her a revolver.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: You know how to use this? She nods. Leaving, she passes the Lubczanski brothers, wh are on their way in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE SALMON Revision - 10-21-07 72.

dialogues.speaker: MOTL LUBCZANSKI
dialogues.text: She is a tasty one, your aristocrat.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: She is not my aristocrat.

dialogues.speaker: ARKADY LUBCZANSKI
dialogues.text: No? We were told, 'hands off,' property of the Commander. Tuvia just stares, daring him to continue.

dialogues.speaker: LATER THAT DAY 111
dialogues.text: Tuvia walks past the now-empty stable heading into the wo A voice calls out of the misty snow.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Lazar. I am coming from camp. The danger is from those coming to camp.

dialogues.speaker: LAZAR
dialogues.text: (SHEEPISH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Tuvia... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE CHERRY Revision - 11-1-07 73.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: No sign of the food mission?

dialogues.speaker: LAZAR
dialogues.text: Not yet. Tuvia looks anxiously into the deep woods.

dialogues.speaker: 111A MEANWHILE
dialogues.text: Lilka and Shulman are walking backwards, retracing their steps to obscure their footprints in the drifting snow.

dialogues.speaker: SHULMAN
dialogues.text: We mustn't have any tracks leading back to base. He loads two sacks of food onto her shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: SHULMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Stay on this side of the creek until you reach the river then up the hill. (points the way) I'll wait here for the others. She nods and trudges on toward camp through waist-deep sn

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN CAMP
dialogues.text: As they head toward a zemylanka, Riva is briefing Tuvia o the sick. Every now and then, he glances toward the woods

dialogues.speaker: RIVA
dialogues.text: --several cases of pneumonia... Also I'm beginning to see signs of scurvy. No one's had a vegetable in weeks.

dialogues.speaker: LAZAR
dialogues.text: Tuvia! Lazar is dragging a WOUNDED MAN back into camp.

dialogues.speaker: RIVA
dialogues.text: Bring him to the infirmary. Tuvia glances back toward the woods. Looks at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: RIVA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...Shulman will look after her. He looks up. She looks at him sympathetically. Apparently his interest in Lilka isn' quite as secret as he imagines

dialogues.speaker: 112A BACK TO THE WOODS 112A
dialogues.text: Exhausted, cold and alone, Lilka is becoming increasingly disoriented in a snowy landscape where every tree looks (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE SALMON Revision - 10-21-07 73A.

dialogues.speaker: 112A CONTINUED
dialogues.text: alike. She turns in a circle, trying to decide which way to go. A MANGY DOG appears out of nowhere, its coat matted, its ribs showing, a wild look in its eye. It GROWLS ferocious

dialogues.speaker: LILKA
dialogues.text: Shoo-- Shoo-- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE CHERRY Revision - 11-1-07 74.

dialogues.speaker: 112A CONTINUED
dialogues.text: But the dog, as ravenous as she, smells the food and won' back down. It inches forward, FOAMING at the mouth. Lilka tries to step back but the dog LUNGES, snapping its jaws. It's terrifying. She looks desperately for help. Suddenly the dog LEAPS at her. She turns away and it rips a sack from her shoulder, knocking her down. Viciously it begins tearing the sack apart in search of the food withi A SHOT RINGS OUT. The dog drops. Lilka holds the smoking gun in two hands. Grimly, she poc the weapon, picks up the sack of food, and starts off. Reconsidering, she walks back and hoists the dead dog ont her shoulder, too. More food.

dialogues.speaker: 112B IN THE INFIRMARY 112B
dialogues.text: Riva bandages Edjelman's head. Tuvia looks at all the sic

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: What's wrong with them all?

dialogues.speaker: RIVA
dialogues.text: If it's typhus we're in trouble. The lice are carriers.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: The partisans have ampicillin. But they say they need it for themselves. In the background Lilka enters, face scratched, blood sme hands and arms -- like some kind of primitive huntress.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (sees he is distracted) Tuvia...

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Medicine for typhus. I heard you. I'll go see Viktor right away. On his way out, he passes Lilka, who is being looked afte

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: LILKA
dialogues.text: Fine. (handing him the gun) Thank you. Tuvia can clearly see that she is shaken -- but he has no time to ask more. He has to find out about the medicine.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: I must go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SALMON Revision - 8-19-07 75.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE A TENT 114
dialogues.text: Viktor, Gramov and Zus are poring over a map of the area.

dialogues.speaker: VIKTOR
dialogues.text: --and every time we try to move, they radio back to police HQ which houses the transmitter...here.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: --So we attack the transmitter.

dialogues.speaker: VIKTOR
dialogues.text: Yes, yes, my Hebrew warrior. Except for the troops in Stankiewcze and the machine guns out front. THE TENT FLAP OPENS. Tuvia enters. He has developed a cou

dialogues.speaker: VIKTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Two Bielski's in one room! To what do we owe this honor?

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: We have sickness. I need ampicillin.

dialogues.speaker: VIKTOR
dialogues.text: This medicine is reserved for fighters.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: If typhus breaks out in our camp, it may spread to yours.

dialogues.speaker: VIKTOR
dialogues.text: I will have to take that chance. Zus looks from one immovable force to the other.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: I must insist. Comrade.

dialogues.speaker: VIKTOR
dialogues.text: You'd better not. Zus is watching this dick-measuring with keen interest.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: There would be medicine in the police headquarters at Stankiewcze, yes? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLUE Revision - 6-26-07 76.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He looks to Gramov, who looks to Viktor, who nods.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tuvia and I grew up there. (looks at Tuvia) Perhaps the Bielski otriad will volunteer to take out the transmitter. Viktor looks from Zus to Tuvia.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Of course. Zus grabs his submachine gun.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: Krensky, Ben Zion. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: THE TOWN OF STAKIEWICZE 115
dialogues.text: is quiet at midnight on this snowy evening.

dialogues.speaker: IN A BACK ALLEY 116
dialogues.text: Tuvia and Zus sit in the cab of an old truck, its exhaust sending plumes of condensation into the freezing night.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: Well... He looks into the back where the others wait, anxiously clutching their weapons. Tuvia tries to hold back a cough

dialogues.speaker: ZUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Stay with the truck. And make sure it's in gear when we get back.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: I'm going in with you.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: I give the orders tonight. Across the square, the police station looms.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: You don't have to do this.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: I don't? (a bitter laugh) What about the typhus? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision - 7-18-07 77.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: So more die. They will anyway. A grim smile from Zus. Tuvia is broken up inside.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: I have been given this mission by my superior officer. He starts to get out the cab. Tuvia reaches into his pock takes out the mezuzah that once blessed their parents' ho

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Zus... (hands him the mezuzah) For luck. Zuz pockets it and joins the others creeping into the shadows. But rather than follow them into the police station, we HOLD on Tuvia's face. Suddenly we HEAR The sound of gunfi Then nothing. Ten seconds. More gunfire. Twenty. It is excruciating. Thirty. The longest CLOSE-UP in film histor

dialogues.speaker: FLASHES OF WHAT IS HAPPENING INSIDE... 117
dialogues.text: Ben Zion bursts in and opens fire, killing two policemen. Krensky jumps the counter and smashes the transmitter. A policeman appears behind them on the stairs and shoots Krensky in the back. Ben Zion whirls and kills him.

dialogues.speaker: OPENS IT. STOPS. HE HAS PROMISED TO WAIT WITH THE TRUCK.
dialogues.text: Zus, meanwhile, rummages cabinets, looking for ampicillin

dialogues.speaker: BEN ZION
dialogues.text: Let's GO! In the back room, Zus keeps rummaging. A window EXPLODES. Ben Zion is hit. Mortally wounded, he sinks to his knees, returning fire as Zus reappears.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA WATCHES 118
dialogues.text: as Zus bursts out the door. He races to the truck and struggles into the passenger seat, BLEEDING FROM HIS SHOULDER.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: Go. GO!

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: What about the others?! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision - 7-18-07 77A.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TRUCK, (TRAVELING)
dialogues.text: From his coat Zus takes out a BLOOD-SOAKED PACKAGE. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE CHERRY Revision - 11-1-07 78.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: Medicine.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: The others?

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: Fighters die so that malbushim may live, that's what you believe, yes? Tuvia absorbs the accusation as if taking a punch.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: So you're a communist now, Zus? Zus lays his head back on the seat, closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: Communist, Zionist, Manicurist, what difference does it make? You got your medicine.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Come back to us. Zus won't look at him.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You are my brother.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: So you remember.

dialogues.speaker: A MOURNER'S CIRCLE IN THE TREES 120
dialogues.text: for Ben Zion and Krensky. Shimon addresses the group.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMON
dialogues.text: Merciful God, we commit our friends Ben Zion and Krensky to your care. We have no more prayers, no more tears. We have run out of blood. Choose another people We PAN PAST the familiar faces.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We have paid for each of your Commandments. We have covered every field and stone with ashes. Sanctify another land. (looks at them) Choose another people. Teach them the Deeds and the Prophecies. Grant us but one more blessing -- Take back the gift of our holiness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YELLOW Revision - 7-30-07 79.

dialogues.speaker: IN A ZEMYLANKA
dialogues.text: Tuvia is still drinking heavily. He is COUGHING STEADILY, his face sweaty with fever. The SOUND of angry voices from outside the bunker.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: Arkady Lubczanski has pulled a knife on Asael, who backs away, STUMBLING into a group of bystanders.

dialogues.speaker: ARKADY
dialogues.text: Next time, I cut off your nose, pisher. Tuvia emerges from his bunker. He is weaving a bit and hi words are slurred.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Whassa problem, Arkady?

dialogues.speaker: ARKADY
dialogues.text: Those who risk their lives to bring back food deserve a larger portion than those who risk nothing.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: Everyone gets the same portion.

dialogues.speaker: ARKADY
dialogues.text: Not when you're serving, pisher. I see you digging to the bottom of the pot for your little forest cutie and her parents...

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: She is my wife!

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Policy is...Same for all. If someone is stealing he'll face consequences. Asael is astonished that Tuvia would go against him in pu and embarrassed by his public drunkenness.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: What consequences? Others are closely watching this test of Tuvia's authorit

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Reduced rations for one week. (a beat) Both of you. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SALMON Revision - 8-19-07 80.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: (in his face)

dialogues.speaker: ARE YOU QUESTIONING MY DECISION
dialogues.text: Arkady is tempted to take him on. But he backs down.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (raises his voice) This matter is settled. Everybody back in line. People are staring at him.

dialogues.speaker: LINE
dialogues.text: His eyes meet Lilka's. She looks away. Asael takes Tuvia' arm and pulls him aside.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: Tuvia, I would never--

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Yes. I know.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: Then why am I to be punished...? Tuvia just takes another swallow from his bottle.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fischer is with them. So is Levine. On food missions, they take first for themselves and only bring back what's left over-- Tuvia's head is throbbing. He closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: --and they spread rumors, that you are power-hungry and corrupt, that you take whatever woman you choose-- (Tuvia can't help but laugh) --that we keep gold for ourselves, and that-- He stops himself.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: --What? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SALMON Revision - 8-19-07 81.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: ...that you drink too much and are no longer fit to lead us.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: .Maybe they're right. Asael looks at him. No longer the brother he once idealiz

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: Zus would have punched him senseless.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Zus.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: I miss him.  TUVIA He has made his choice. He reels away toward the woods.

dialogues.speaker: 122A IN HIS ZEMYLANKA
dialogues.text: Tuvia is lying in his bunker, vomiting and burning up wit fever. Shimon has brought him soup.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMON
dialogues.text: Drink this. (WINKS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the bottom of the pot. Tuvia can barely get the soup down.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: ...the way they look at me... with their pasty faces. Let them starve, we're all going to die out here anyway.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMON
dialogues.text: Not easy being the big boss. Moses was a lonely man when he led us out of bondage.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: ...Moses.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMON
dialogues.text: So I'm a sucker for a biblical allusion. But what is society without leaders. Without leaders, we falter. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE CHERRY Revision - 11-1-07 81A.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: I am not a leader.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMON
dialogues.text: Neither was Moses, but somehow that seemed to work out.

dialogues.speaker: THE PARTISAN CAMP 123
dialogues.text: Several partisans are singing a drinking song while Zus silently soaks his feet in a bucket. Lova walks in. His face is black and blue.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: Lova, what happened? Who did this? Lova sits and buries his head in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Lova. Tell me. Who?

dialogues.speaker: LOVA
dialogues.text: Gramov. Two others. I used the officer's latrine.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: For this they beat you? Lova is trying not to weep.

dialogues.speaker: LOVA
dialogues.text: They said they wouldn't shit in the same hole as a Jew. Zus gets to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zus bursts in to find Panchenko deep in conversation with Gramov and others. They look up at the intrusion.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: Forgive me, Commander.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zus. Join us. He offers him a glass of vodka. Zus doesn't take it.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: I want to report the mistreatment of a comrade. Gramov looks up. Zus meets his eye. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE GOLDENROD Revision - 10-21-07 81B.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This man beat Comrade Lova -- for no reason at all.

dialogues.speaker: GRAMOV
dialogues.text: I had a perfectly good reason. He is a Jew. The other men LAUGH. Panchenko frowns at Gramov.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and you are an ignorant Tartar. (offers Zus vodka) Ignore him. Here...

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: Anti-semitism is a violation of Party discipline. Panchenko sighs. Does he really have to deal with this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's right, Gramov. Apologize to the Jew.

dialogues.speaker: GRAMOV
dialogues.text: I apologize, Jew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There. You see? (...a command) Now drink up. Zus doesn't know what to do. He accepts the vodka.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guards ring the snowy perimeter.

dialogues.speaker: THE BLURRED IMAGE OF AN ANGEL FRAMED BY A HALO OF SUN
dialogues.text: as it swims into focus. Tuvia opens his eyes. It is Lilka She sits beside him, mopping his forehead with a cool rag

dialogues.speaker: LILKA
dialogues.text: Your fever broke in the night. The medicine helped.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: How long was I asleep?

dialogues.speaker: LILKA
dialogues.text: Two days. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SALMON Revision - 8-19-07 81C-83.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: And you've nursed me the whole time?

dialogues.speaker: LILKA
dialogues.text: Chaya helped.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Did you study nursing at university?

dialogues.speaker: LILKA
dialogues.text: We devoted ourselves to more essential knowledge -- like Greek Philosophy and Latin. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SALMON Revision - 8-19-07 84.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: I never went to university.

dialogues.speaker: LILKA
dialogues.text: What kind of work did you do? Before.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: My wife's father had a store. Before the Race Laws. (looks at her) She is is dead.

dialogues.speaker: LILKA
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Tell me more about university.

dialogues.speaker: LILKA
dialogues.text: It all feels like a dream. I spent months trying to master Chopin's nocturnes.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: I'd love to hear you play.

dialogues.speaker: LILKA
dialogues.text: You know Chopin?

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Who doesn't? Chopin the butcher from Novogrudok.

dialogues.speaker: LILKA
dialogues.text: (LAUGHS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're well enough to tease me, you're well enough to eat. I'll see what's for supper. She gets up to go.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Thank you, Lilka.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE TUVIA'S BUNKER 127
dialogues.text: THE LUBCZANSKI'S have taken the fullest advantage of Tuvi illness. There are now TWO LINES of people waiting for food. The malbushim line up like prison inmates. Lazar looks in his bowl -- two beans floating in a scummy broth.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE SHORTER LINE
dialogues.text: Motl, Arkady, Fischer, Levine and a few others are enjoyi real food. Lazar calls out from the other line. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE CHERRY Revision - 11-1-07 85.

dialogues.speaker: LAZAR
dialogues.text: Hey, Arkady This isn't soup, it's piss.

dialogues.speaker: ARKADY
dialogues.text: I will piss on your head and you  will say it's raining. Eat it.  The rest of Lubczanski's cabal laughs. TUVIA emerges from his bunker. The first thing he sees is Asael, whose face is BATTERED AND SWOLLEN.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: What happened? Asael just looks over at the food line -- where Arkady ha grabbed Chaya by the waist -- to the delight of the other Tuvia strides over to them.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: ARKADY
dialogues.text: New policy. Fighters get better food.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Against my orders...

dialogues.speaker: ARKADY
dialogues.text: You are no longer Commander. Sorry. Tuvia nods, considering his remark for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: AND THEN TAKES OUT HIS PISTOL AND SHOOTS ARKADY IN THE CH
dialogues.text: He then turns the gun on Motl and the others -- they literally cower in fear. He raises his voice to those watching.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: As long as I am the leader of this group, you will obey my commands.

dialogues.speaker: NOTHING. ANYONE WANTS TO LEAVE,
dialogues.text: THEY LEAVE. NOW! The rest work.  Every morning we get up and we work.  WE WORK. In the snow and the cold  and the dark. Tomorrow we begin to  build ten new zemylanka, we double  the number of food missions.  ...We work. (looks down at Arkady) Take his body into the woods and leave it for the wolves. He turns and walks away. As he passes the food lines, peo subtly move out of his way and whisper after he is gone. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE CHERRY Revision - 11-1-07 85A.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Whereas once he was greeted warmly by all, now his isolat is complete.  He is the Commander.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE CHERRY Revision - 11-1-07 86.

dialogues.speaker: 127A TUVIA CAREENS THROUGH THE TREES 127A
dialogues.text: Tripping over roots, and finally leaning against a tree, is mumbling, almost incoherent -- part prayer, part profanity.

dialogues.speaker: THE FIRST BUD OF SPRING 129
dialogues.text: struggles through patches of snow. Ice drips from branche

dialogues.speaker: 130A THE OTRIAD 130A
dialogues.text: Takes a group portrait. The forest is green again.

dialogues.speaker: THE SUNSHINE IS WARM 131
dialogues.text: on the women's bodies as they bathe in the river.

dialogues.speaker: CHAYA
dialogues.text: Who has the soap? I know there was a little left?

dialogues.speaker: BELLA
dialogues.text: Use the sand. It's good for your skin.

dialogues.speaker: RIVA
dialogues.text: And what skin! And already married, too! Bella laughs. Chaya splashes her playfully with water.

dialogues.speaker: BELLA
dialogues.text: I've turned into a skeleton.

dialogues.speaker: CHAYA
dialogues.text: And you were always so worried about staying slim.

dialogues.speaker: BELLA
dialogues.text: When we get out of this forest I am going to eat only cake and grow as big as a house. Tamara appears. She's wearing a long overcoat.

dialogues.speaker: LILKA
dialogues.text: Join us. At least the sun is warm. (Tamara turns away; Lilka joins her) Tamara?

dialogues.speaker: TAMARA
dialogues.text: I can't, Lilka... (lowers her voice) I'm pregnant. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE SALMON Revision - 10-21-07 86A.

dialogues.speaker: LILKA
dialogues.text: I had no idea.

dialogues.speaker: TAMARA
dialogues.text: I've kept it hidden for months but now it's obvious. No one can know. They move away from the others. Tamara shows her.

dialogues.speaker: TAMARA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It could come any day. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE CHERRY Revision - 11-1-07 87.

dialogues.speaker: LILKA
dialogues.text: ..Who is the father?

dialogues.speaker: TAMARA
dialogues.text: I--- It was when I was escaping. A man with a gun stopped me. I thought he was a Partisan. He told me to follow him and he took me to this place... The memory overwhelms her. She begins to break down.

dialogues.speaker: TAMARA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Inside me something broke....I wanted to die. Every night I have nightmares -- what will happen when Tuvia finds out.

dialogues.speaker: LILKA
dialogues.text: He will understand.

dialogues.speaker: TAMARA
dialogues.text: No. You mustn't tell him!

dialogues.speaker: LILKA
dialogues.text: I won't. Don't worry. (touches her arm) What are you going to do? Tamara's eyes fill with a new resolve.

dialogues.speaker: TAMARA
dialogues.text: I feel this new life inside me. It's the only thing keeping me going. I won't give it up, I'll kill myself. Lilka puts her arm around her.

dialogues.speaker: 131A IN THE DEEP FOREST
dialogues.text: From his belt hang the pelts of two dead rabbits. He hears A SOUND. Three GERMAN SOLDIERS are putting camouflage on their helmets. Beyond, A GERMAN ARMORED COLUMN. The assault is coming.

dialogues.speaker: THE CAMP 132
dialogues.text: where Shimon and Malbin are playing chess. Shimon has developed a bad cough.

dialogues.speaker: MALBIN
dialogues.text: You call that a move?

dialogues.speaker: SHIMON
dialogues.text: I call it an inevitable conclusion based on unimpeachable reasoning. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE GREEN Revision - 10-14-07 A87.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The question, my friend the Genius, is what are you going to do about it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHERRY Revision - 9-2-07 87A.

dialogues.speaker: MALBIN
dialogues.text: I'm thinking about what I'm going to do about it.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMON
dialogues.text: Aha! I got him!

dialogues.speaker: MALBIN
dialogues.text: You didn't get me. You think you got me? How about this?

dialogues.speaker: SHIMON
dialogues.text: (GOBSMACKED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who would make a move like that?

dialogues.speaker: MALBIN
dialogues.text: A genius maybe. Tuvia has been listening nearby. Aron races into the camp

dialogues.speaker: ARON
dialogues.text: Tuvia... We SEE Aron whispering in Tuvia's ear. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE SALMON Revision - 10-21-07 88.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: (calls out) Asael! Asael comes running.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get a message to Zus. He's got to tell Viktor they're coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuvia stands peering out into the forest. Asael joins him

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: Lazar spotted another patrol. They're getting closer. Tuvia nods. Suddenly, he HEARS a strange sound. An animal

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Do you hear that?

dialogues.speaker: IN THE WOMEN'S ZEMYLANKA 134
dialogues.text: We HEAR the SOUND for what it is... The cry of a newborn. A baby boy in this mud manger. Riva and Lilka have assist Tamara holds her new baby to her breast. Suddenly -- the blanket serving as a door is SWEPT ASIDE. TUVIA stands there. Tamara cries out and shields the baby Lilka springs up and pushes him back outside.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE BUNKER 135
dialogues.text: Tuvia walks angrily. Lilka keeps up.

dialogues.speaker: LILKA
dialogues.text: She promises not to take extra food...

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: This is against my orders.

dialogues.speaker: LILKA
dialogues.text: So you are going to shoot her, too? Tuvia stares at her. He has never seen this side of her.

dialogues.speaker: LILKA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Please, Tuvia. The baby is all she has to live for.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: I cannot allow it. He turns away. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE SALMON Revision - 10-21-07 88A.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Lilka SPINS him around, surprising him with her strength and the strength of her passion. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision - 7-18-07 89.

dialogues.speaker: LILKA
dialogues.text: You must let it live!

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: I cannot keep the living alive. Tamara and the man who fathered this child are responsible for its fate.

dialogues.speaker: LILKA
dialogues.text: She was raped by the Nazis. Tuvia closes his eyes. He is tired of being in charge, tired of being the arbiter of other peoples' fate.

dialogues.speaker: LILKA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...You tell us to hold onto our humanity. Not to become like animals. What better way than by bringing a life into this world of suffering and death. It's our only hope. Tuvia is undone by her intensity. The very nearness of her. The smell of her newly-washed hair. The glow of her skin. He looks at her. And nods in surrender.

dialogues.speaker: LILKA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thank you, Tuvia. She kisses him. A chaste kiss of gratitude. She pulls back and they look into each other's eyes. The next kiss is something entirely different.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Lilka...

dialogues.speaker: LILKA
dialogues.text: I knew what was expected of the women here -- yet you never touched me...

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Shhh..

dialogues.speaker: LILKA
dialogues.text: I'm not afraid of anything, Tuvia. I'm not even afraid of you. They kiss deeply.

dialogues.speaker: IN TUVIA'S BUNKER
dialogues.text: Lilka lies in his arms. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE GOLDENROD Revision - 10-21-07 90.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: The Germans are coming into the forest. I don't know what is going to become of us.

dialogues.speaker: LILKA
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter. If I had stayed in the ghetto I'd be dead. You saved my life.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: No. You have saved mine. He reaches for her but before they can begin to make love again-- THE BLANKET DOOR IS PUSHED ASIDE. Malbin is there

dialogues.speaker: MALBIN
dialogues.text: Oh... ..I..... Hello, Lilka.

dialogues.speaker: LILKA
dialogues.text: Hello, Asael.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: MALBIN
dialogues.text: We've caught one.

dialogues.speaker: A GERMAN SS SCOUT, HANDS TIED BEHIND HIS BACK 137
dialogues.text: is led into the clearing. He wears the same uniform as those who marched the villagers into the forest for execution.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: He's a scout.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: They're coming for us. Group members have begun to gather around him. They begin to hurl insults -- schtik drek, paskudnyak -- as the hapl man is pushed to his knees.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: We found this in his pouch. He hands Tuvia a sheaf of documents -- including a map. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHERRY Revision - 9-2-07 91.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Entrance points, wetlands, obstacles. (hands it to Shimon) You read this.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMON
dialogues.text: (re: the documents) They've assigned an entire division to surround the forest. A tidal wave is coming.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: Don't they have a war to fight?

dialogues.speaker: SHIMON
dialogues.text: (still reading) Assault begins in two days. Passover. How fitting. Meanwhile, some of the group have begun TORMENTING the ma

dialogues.speaker: MOTL
dialogues.text: Monster! He kicks him in the head.

dialogues.speaker: SHULMAN
dialogues.text: Bulvan! Shulman PUNCHES him in the face.

dialogues.speaker: GERMAN COURIER
dialogues.text: Bitte....Bitte...

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: (to Asael) Did you reach Viktor?

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: He's on his way. The tormenting of the poor courier is gaining intensity.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA--
dialogues.text: The German lets loose a torrent of pleading.

dialogues.speaker: GERMAN COURIER
dialogues.text: Ich habe frau und kinder!

dialogues.speaker: SHIMON
dialogues.text: He says he has a wife and children. Lazar picks up a stick. The German tries to crawl away; the crowd blocks his escape, pushing him back into the center. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHERRY Revision - 9-2-07 91A.

dialogues.speaker: LAZAR
dialogues.text: So did I!

dialogues.speaker: RIVA
dialogues.text: If you let him go, he will lead them back here. Tuvia looks at Malbin. What to do? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHERRY Revision - 9-2-07 92.

dialogues.speaker: MALBIN
dialogues.text: Ask if he'll promise not to reveal our location. Shimon translates.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMON
dialogues.text: Sie mussen versprechen nicht zu sagan wo wir sind. The man looks up at him, pleadingly.

dialogues.speaker: GERMAN COURIER
dialogues.text: Nein....Nein...

dialogues.speaker: SHULMAN
dialogues.text: He'll say anything. He breaks the stick across the man's back.

dialogues.speaker: LAZAR
dialogues.text: We want justice...

dialogues.speaker: MOTL
dialogues.text: Justice... Soon it is a chant: "Justice! .Justice!" Tuvia looks at their faces. Only months ago they were decorous, civilize Now they are hungry, almost feral. Murderous. Bella has been silently watching. She steps into the circ looks down at the terrified German man.

dialogues.speaker: BELLA
dialogues.text: My son's name was David. David Kagan. We SEE now that she is holding a sharpened hoe.

dialogues.speaker: BELLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He was fifteen. He had blue eyes. She raises it above her head.

dialogues.speaker: BELLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He played the piano. She swings with all her might. The others watch with a mi of thrilled horror and perverse delight. A line has been crossed. Riva steps forward, holding a large shovel.

dialogues.speaker: RIVA
dialogues.text: My sister's name was Ellie... As she swings the shovel, the CAMERA begins to back away. Miriam steps forward, carrying a large rock.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: My husband was Meyer... The group closes in, obscuring our view of the body. Aron can't take any more. He runs off into the woods. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHERRY Revision - 9-2-07 A92.

dialogues.speaker: MOTL
dialogues.text: My parents, Sol and Raya. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHERRY Revision - 9-2-07 92A.

dialogues.speaker: AVRAM
dialogues.text: For my daughter, Sonya.

dialogues.speaker: MORDECAI
dialogues.text: For my mother.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: My sister.

dialogues.speaker: LILKA
dialogues.text: My whole family.

dialogues.speaker: JUSTICE
dialogues.text: Tuvia closes his eyes. He has done nothing to stop it. Asael looks at Malbin and Shimon. They are undone by what they have witnessed. Tuvia walks away. Behind them, the group separates -- staring at the lifele body on the ground. And then they look at each other, the blood lust sated, beginning to reckon with what they have done. What they have become.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA STANDS ALONE IN THE FOREST, HIS FACE IN SHADOW
dialogues.text: He sees Aron, squatting beside a tree, crying silently. Tuvia kneels beside him, cradling him.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Reeboynoy shel oylum... Lord of the Universe. We have done unspeakable things yet still I seek your mercy... He HEARS something. Malbin waits at the edge of the fores His face is drawn and pale from what has just happened. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE GREEN Revision - 10-14-07 93.

dialogues.speaker: MALBIN
dialogues.text: Viktor is here.

dialogues.speaker: VIKTOR AND ZUS 139
dialogues.text: are waiting in the clearing. Tuvia approaches. He and Zus nod to each other but do not speak. It is excruciating. Tuvia and Viktor walk into the woods. Zus waits with othe BODYGUARDS as Asael joins them. Zus wears a Nazi jacket.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: He doesn't look good.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: I could say the same about you. Where'd you get the jacket?

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: Let's just say the former owner no longer had need of it. Zus winks. The other bodyguards stare impassively.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Embrace me. Asael looks confused for a moment, then embraces him.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (WHISPERING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hide this. (shoves a revolver into his pocket) Wolnicky stores ammunition for us in his barn. There's no guard. He slaps Asael fondly on the cheek and rejoins his comrad

dialogues.speaker: VIKTOR AND TUVIA 140
dialogues.text: sit on a downed tree and converse in Russian, with subtit

dialogues.speaker: VIKTOR
dialogues.text: You found these on the prisoner? Tuvia nods. Viktor studies the scout's documents. Tisking

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: We can't fight an entire division.

dialogues.speaker: VIKTOR
dialogues.text: The battle on the Eastern Front has begun. The more troops we engage here, the fewer they have to attack the Motherland. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE GREEN Revision - 10-14-07 93A.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: We've done our part for the Motherland. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUFF Revision - 9-2-07 94.

dialogues.speaker: VIKTOR
dialogues.text: My orders are to take command of all partisan operations. You will bring the rest of your fighters to me.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: And the others? Old people, women and children.

dialogues.speaker: VIKTOR
dialogues.text: In war there are casualties.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: And if I refuse?

dialogues.speaker: VIKTOR
dialogues.text: You are officially a deserter. Do you know the policy on dealing with deserters? Viktor unfolds a paper flyer from his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: VIKTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...The Germans are offering fifty thousand marks for information leading to your capture. (hands it to him) Not a very flattering likeness. Too Jewish. Viktor rejoins his bodyguards, turns back for a last word

dialogues.speaker: VIKTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Have your men in my camp by tonight. He walks off. Asael takes the wanted poster from Tuvia.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: I wouldn't show this around. There are some who'd turn you in for less.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Down below, Viktor and the Russian partisans have struck their tents and hidden beneath the sheltering trees. Viktor's gaze follows the plane. He gives an order into a field radio. Zus has been listening. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SALMON Revision - 8-19-07 95.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: You want them to find Tuvia's camp. Viktor just looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're deliberately sacrificing them so we can remain safe?

dialogues.speaker: VIKTOR
dialogues.text: No. So we can keep fighting. Everyone must sacrifice in the struggle.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: Those are my brothers.

dialogues.speaker: VIKTOR
dialogues.text: I am your brother! He is your brother! Comrade Zus. Your Jewish sentimentality is heart-warming, but counter-revolutionary. Zus has secretly known he would hear these words. He grip his rifle but holds his tongue.

dialogues.speaker: THE SPOTTER PLANE
dialogues.text: Tuvia stares up at it. Have they been spotted? Shimon is sitting nearby with a group of children. He loo pale. His cough is worse. He is very ill.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMON
dialogues.text: ...but the children of Israel were afraid to leave Egypt. Until Moses said, 'Do not trust in me, trust in God.' He will take care of you' (a wrenching cough) And so tomorrow we celebrate the Passover by sitting around and arguing just as we have done for centuries. Tuvia stares at them, a curious expression on his face. Malbin comes to stand beside him.

dialogues.speaker: MALBIN
dialogues.text: (looking at the plane) Did it see us? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision - 7-18-07 96.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Tomorrow is Passover. Yes?

dialogues.speaker: MALBIN
dialogues.text: ...How should I know?

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Moses. The Exodus. Malbin doesn't get it at first.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: --He left before Pharaoh could stop them. Now Malbin understands. He looks at Shimon.

dialogues.speaker: MALBIN
dialogues.text: You want to move them all? The old, the sick. They'll never make it. It isn't the first time Tuvia has consigned people to the death, and apparently it won't be the last.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: We leave now. Spread the word.

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: is a blur of activity as everyone mobilizes for evacuatio Sacks and cooking equipment is tied onto impromptu packs. Asael and Malbin coax the older people into motion--

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: Come, tateh--

dialogues.speaker: OPPENHEIM
dialogues.text: But my tools-- The SOUND of approaching aircraft. Tuvia searches the sky Riva pairs each of the elderly with a child. Tamara tucks her newborn under her coat. The SOUND of the approaching aircraft grows LOUDER. Peopl look up, shielding their eyes. Then from out of the sun, two ominous silhouettes:

dialogues.speaker: THE SCREAMING WHISTLE OF THE FIRST BOMBER 144
dialogues.text: panics the crowd. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GOLDENROD Revision - 8-16-07 97.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Some race into the forest; others are frozen. Tuvia grabs people and bodily drags them to cover. STRAFING 20MM CANNON chew up the ground. Several people are hit before they can reach cover. Lilka herds everyone she can into:

dialogues.speaker: A BUNKER 145
dialogues.text: where people crowd in like sardines. Chaya and Riva gathe children around them. They hear the WHISTLE of an incomin shell....BOOM! Dirt from the roof rains down on them.

dialogues.speaker: BOMBS BEGIN TO RAIN DOWN 146
dialogues.text: Dirt and debris everywhere. AN INCENDIARY SHELL HITS high in a tree. Its branches burst into flame. An hysterical woman leaps out of a bunker and is BLOWN AP

dialogues.speaker: MEANWHILE
dialogues.text: Zus listens helplessly to the distant sound of bombs drop on his brothers.

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN THE BIELSKI CAMP
dialogues.text: It explodes into a million pieces. Wood shrapnel everywhe Where once was a bunker, now there is only a gaping crate Tuvia races into the maelstrom to help the wounded.

dialogues.speaker: AN EXPLOSION KNOCKS HIM DOWN
dialogues.text: He tries to clear his head but he cannot focus. ALL SOUND FADES AWAY to be replaced by a high-pitched hum.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA'S WORLD IS IN SLOW-MOTION 149
dialogues.text: Falling dirt and debris, tumbling bodies, exploding bunke a surreal effect.

dialogues.speaker: IN REAL TIME
dialogues.text: Cowering in safety, Malbin sees Tuvia lying in the open a gathers his courage -- RACING through danger to his side.

dialogues.speaker: MALBIN
dialogues.text: Are you alright? Tuvia shakes his head, points to his ears. He cannot hear (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GOLDENROD Revision - 8-16-07 98.

dialogues.speaker: ARE...YOU...ALRIGHT
dialogues.text: When Tuvia speaks, his WORDS sound DULL and MUFFLED.

dialogues.speaker: THE GERMANS...COMING...
dialogues.text: Malbin looks around, panicked. Asael appears out of the smoke, yells at Malbin above the din.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: Get them out of the bunkers! Malbin runs off. Asael helps Tuvia to his feet. A nearby explosion SHOWERS THEM with dirt as they CRAWL to safety. The world RAMPS BACK TO NORMAL SPEED at a dizzying rate.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We need to hold them off...until the rest are safe. Tuvia still can't hear. Asael pantomimes firing a rifle.

dialogues.speaker: ...HOLD...THEM...OFF
dialogues.text: Tuvia nods, trying to clear the buzzing in his head.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: With Levine and Miriam... There. (points out positions) Lazar, Rosa, and Schmuel. There and there. (Tuvia nods) And me. Tuvia shakes his head, no.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yes. He runs off. Still clearing his head, Tuvia regains his footing -- suddenly realizing the the bombing has stopped

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GOLDENROD Revision - 8-16-07 98A.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE ENTRY WAY TO A ZEMYLANKA 151
dialogues.text: Malbin appears, eyes wild.

dialogues.speaker: MALBIN
dialogues.text: Everybody out! Now! But the group's natural reaction is to stay huddled in sa (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GOLDENROD Revision - 8-16-07 99.

dialogues.speaker: THE COSSACKS ARE COMING
dialogues.text: This gets the job done. People begin to crawl out.

dialogues.speaker: OTHERS EMERGE FROM THE BUNKERS 152
dialogues.text: YOUNG PEOPLE holding hands with OLD, PARENTS with CHILDRE on their backs. Tuvia urges Lilka and Bella to hurry them into the woods.

dialogues.speaker: MEANWHILE
dialogues.text: take up their assigned positions: Levine mans the heavy machine gun behind a log; Lazar, Miriam and Rosa in the trees. Tuvia anxiously waits for the last of the women and child to disappear into the forest.

dialogues.speaker: A SUDDEN SILENCE DESCENDS
dialogues.text: Tuvia realizes the bombers have broken off their attack. He knows the ground troops will soon follow. He turns to Asael, grabbing his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Don't try to fight... Just slow them down. Then join us. Asael nods. No need for more words. They embrace fiercely Asael pushes Chaya toward Tuvia.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: Take her. She resists, clinging to his arm for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Come. He forces her to join him and catch up to the others.

dialogues.speaker: THE CAMP 154
dialogues.text: is eerily quiet as the dust begins to settle. The defende check their weapons with grim efficiency. They are no lon inept innocents; they have become warriors.

dialogues.speaker: DEEPER IN THE WOODS 155
dialogues.text: Tuvia catches up with the fleeing group and urges them on

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: We study their faces. Beautiful in their stoic acceptance (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GOLDENROD Revision - 8-16-07 99A.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SUDDENLY -- A FUSILLADE from the woods. Rosa falls dead. The defenders RETURN FIRE. Levine fires the machine gun; Miriam feeds the belt.

dialogues.speaker: UP AHEAD WITH THE FLEEING GROUP 157
dialogues.text: Tuvia hears small arms fire. He knows what it means.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUFF Revision - 9-2-07 100.

dialogues.speaker: BACK AT THE CAMP 158
dialogues.text: The rear guard action can't hold out for very long. Tree by tree, they begin to fall back. Asael fires blindly into the murky shadows. The SOUND of man crying out. Then Levine is hit. Miriam pushes him out of the way and TAKES OVER. She expertly kills several assault troops who appear out of the woods. The rest of the attackers TAKE COVER.

dialogues.speaker: WITH THE FLEEING GROUP 159
dialogues.text: Malbin waits anxiously for Tuvia, clutching a map.

dialogues.speaker: MALBIN
dialogues.text: (struggling to control his panic) This swamp here...goes...for miles.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Show me.

dialogues.speaker: BACK AT THE CAMP 160
dialogues.text: Lazar runs from tree to tree, keeping up a steady stream fire. He is surprisingly brave. Until A GRENADE flies out of the woods and lands at his feet, killing him instantly The Assault Troops have begun to outflank them. Asael is suddenly in jeopardy. Sara sees the danger.

dialogues.speaker: GO
dialogues.text: Miriam keeps their ATTACKERS pinned down as the two men race for new positions. Then she is hit. She keeps firing anyway, her finger locked on the trigger even as she is dying. More troops begin firing from their flank. Asael has no choice but to break off. They race into the woods.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO THE FLEEING GROUP 161
dialogues.text: Tuvia hears the guns go silent. This, too, has meaning.

dialogues.speaker: A RISE REVEALS THE IMMENSITY OF THE KRASNAYA GORKA SW
dialogues.text: Malbin stares at what lies ahead.

dialogues.speaker: MALBIN
dialogues.text: Oh, my God... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TAN Revision - 9-10-07 100A.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
