dialogues.text: Are the others back yet? (Malbin looks stricken; he shakes his head) ..Asael? Malbin shakes his head once more. Asael is not coming bac Chaya begins to weep. Riva comforts her.

dialogues.speaker: SHULMAN
dialogues.text: We've got to keep going!

dialogues.speaker: BELLA
dialogues.text: The Germans will be here any minute!

dialogues.speaker: MALBIN
dialogues.text: (to Tuvia) Do we wait...a while?

dialogues.speaker: MORDECAI
dialogues.text: We could hide...

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: I say, fight them here.

dialogues.speaker: MOTL
dialogues.text: Yes. Fight!

dialogues.speaker: SHULMAN
dialogues.text: That's crazy! Tuvia is in hell. If he waits for Asael, he risks them al being caught. Suddenly it all falls apart. Tuvia sinks to his knees as if his legs can no longer bear his weight.

dialogues.speaker: MALBIN
dialogues.text: Tuvia--? Tuvia can't speak. He has no more answers. Nothing to say. He stares at the impenetrable swamp. The end of the line. The sudden vacuum of leadership is felt by them all. They stare at one another, anxious and rudderless.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN, (ZOE)
dialogues.text: My father cannot make it.

dialogues.speaker: RONA
dialogues.text: There are snakes-- Tamara's newborn is crying. She tries to comfort it. An old woman stares at the swamp in terror.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: The children...

dialogues.speaker: SHULMAN
dialogues.text: We'll put them on our shoulders. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TAN Revision - 9-10-07 100A1.

dialogues.speaker: BELLA
dialogues.text: Tuvia, what do we do? Oppenheim is petrified. Rona is crying.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA--
dialogues.text: And still Tuvia is silent. More arguing. A general MURMUR of dread is rising. Malbin goes to kneel beside Shimon, who is covered in swe undone by the forced march.

dialogues.speaker: MALBIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What's wrong with him?

dialogues.speaker: SHIMON
dialogues.text: (fighting for breath) ...He... ..is... ..tired. Malbin hears something, looks up.

dialogues.speaker: FROM HIGH ABOVE
dialogues.text: They have been found. Lilka kneels beside Tuvia. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TAN Revision - 9-10-07 100B.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She takes his hand silently.

dialogues.speaker: COME--
dialogues.text: He shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: You have a weapon? She shows him her revolver. He checks the clip, then look into her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Use it on yourself before you let them take you. She nods gravely. Suddenly a VOICE interrupts.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Why are we stopping? Everyone turns. It's Asael. Back from the dead. He hands off a wounded comrade to Riva's care.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: (WILD-EYED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're coming! (to Tuvia) Why aren't we moving? Tuvia looks up at him, lost. Almost helpless.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We must keep going!

dialogues.speaker: TAMARA
dialogues.text: In there?

dialogues.speaker: RONA
dialogues.text: It is impossible! More murmuring. Asael raises his voice.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: Nothing is impossible! What we have done is impossible! The murmuring quiets. Asael meets Tuvia's eyes. He is literally willing his old brother to be strong for them, as he has been, time and again.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: God will not part these waters. We will do it ourselves.

dialogues.speaker: RONA
dialogues.text: But how? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GOLDENROD Revision - 8-16-07 100B1.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: Not by miracles. By our strength. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHERRY Revision - 9-2-07 100C.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (turning to the man beside him) Take the rope from your pack. (confused; he obeys) Now, you....give me your belt.

dialogues.speaker: SHULMAN
dialogues.text: We don't have enough rope.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: We'll link arms. Make a chain. A human chain.

dialogues.speaker: MOTL
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? Tuvia is deeply moved. His little brother has become a man. Once more, he finds his voice.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Each person takes care of the other. (meeting Asael's eye) .Give him your belt. Asael nods at Tuvia gratefully. The group is hushed, apprehensive. Then:

dialogues.speaker: ONE MAN
dialogues.text: Removes his belt and offers it to Asael.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER STANDS, HOLDING HIS BELT
dialogues.text: And then another. One by one they offer them. There is something quietly heroic in the gesture. Tuvia looks at the group, looks away, fighting back emoti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SALMON Revision - 8-18-07 100D-100E.

dialogues.speaker: 162A THEY WADE IN, WAIST HIGH 162A
dialogues.text: People link arms and hold on for dear life yet still they flounder. A man goes under, is pulled up. A harrowing undertaking.

dialogues.speaker: 162AA THE BELTS ARE ROPED ACROSS THE DEEP POOL 162AA
dialogues.text: People cling to it as they drag themselves, hand over han (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE CHERRY Revision - 11-1-07 101.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: No tracks on land. Get back in. It is almost impossible to make any progress. Especially when one is weak and malnourished.

dialogues.speaker: 162C IN A DEEP BOG 162C
dialogues.text: The mud sticks to their clothes, faces. Soon they are indistinguishable from their surroundings. When one person sinks in the muck, it takes three to get him back on his feet. The column slows. Tuvia gestures for them to keep moving. They can't. Literally cannot. He begins to physically push them on. Sometimes harshly. Eventually they are moving again.

dialogues.speaker: A GHOSTLY LANDSCAPE 163
dialogues.text: Gnarled bare trees shrouded in mist. They trudge forward, their expressions wan and empty. Tuvia find Malbin and pulls him aside.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: (WHISPERING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much farther? Malbin shrugs his shoulders. Who knows...?

dialogues.speaker: 163A THE WATER IS ALMOST HEAD HIGH 163A
dialogues.text: Parents hoist children onto their shoulders, hold weapons overhead as they claw at tall reeds to propel themselves forward, step by tortuous step. SHIMON clings to a tree. His wracking cough is terrifying and he is deathly pale.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Come... Shimon can't catch his breath, he just shakes his head, n He can't go on. Tuvia half-drags, half-carries him onward

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHERRY Revision - 9-2-07 102.

dialogues.speaker: A SPIT OF LAND IN THE SWAMP
dialogues.text: They rest, eat what little food is left. A litter carryin Shimon is deposited on dry ground. He is barely alive.

dialogues.speaker: MALBIN
dialogues.text: Is he...? Tuvia shakes his head. It's only a matter of time. The Spotter Plane drones overhead.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Take off your glasses. Reflections. Tuvia moves off to check on the others.

dialogues.speaker: MALBIN
dialogues.text: Shimon, listen to me, the physical plane is just an illusion. Only the spiritual plane is real.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMON
dialogues.text: (fighting for breath) No. The physical plane is where man acts to redeem himself.

dialogues.speaker: MALBIN
dialogues.text: You've redeemed yourself enough, you should shut up now.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMON
dialogues.text: Look who's talking about shutting up... I need to tell you something.

dialogues.speaker: MALBIN
dialogues.text: (leans closer) What is it?

dialogues.speaker: SHIMON
dialogues.text: You shouldn't think so much. The world around you is beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: MALBIN
dialogues.text: (stunned; looks around) This world?

dialogues.speaker: SHIMON
dialogues.text: Even this one. Tuvia has come to sit beside Lilka. She leans into him.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: We're lost.

dialogues.speaker: LILKA
dialogues.text: No. ..No. She puts her arms around him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHERRY Revision - 9-2-07 102A.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They hold each other and drift off to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: AT NIGHTFALL
dialogues.text: sit around a campfire at the edge of the swamp.

dialogues.speaker: FROM NEARBY
dialogues.text: The LIGHTS of their fire can be seen flickering through t reeds as the ragged column MOVES SILENTLY past.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Not a sound. Pass the word. We watch as the ORDER is passed down the line. Parents hold hands over their childrens' mouths. Shimon i carried on an improvised litter made of branches.

dialogues.speaker: A FOREST CROSSROADS 166
dialogues.text: Panchenko and a few others are on horseback. Behind them the rest of the Partisans are marching away. Zus and the Jewish fighters are on foot, awaiting orders. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE CHERRY Revision - 11-1-07 103.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will hold this crossroads until the brigade has completed its retreat. Zus looks around at the position.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: For how long? Panchenko's orders are never to be questioned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until you are ordered to withdraw.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: And if we cannot hold the position? Panchenko looks at Gramov, who stands nearby cradling a submachine gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Comrade Gramov will enforce discipline, if necessary. Gramov smiles. The implications are clear: nobody retreat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have served us well, Comrade.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: (a wintry smile) I am so honored, Comrade. Panchenko wheels his horse and gallops off. Zus and his men take cover in the woods. In the distance we can HEAR the unmistakable SOUND of approaching armor. Lova kneels beside Zus.

dialogues.speaker: LOVA
dialogues.text: What are we doing here? Zus? Half a mile down the road, A TANK rumbles into view.

dialogues.speaker: LOVA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tell me. Who are we doing this for? With a shaking hand, Zus tries to light a Molotov cocktai but his matches are wet. He reaches into his pocket for more. Instead he finds the mezuzah that was once affixed his family's door. As he stares at it, the SOUND of the approaching tank gro louder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YELLOW Revision - 7-30-07 103A-105.

dialogues.speaker: THE KRASNAYA GORKA SWAMP 167
dialogues.text: empties at last into a shallow river. On the opposite ban is dry land, and beyond, the deep forest. And safety. The bedraggled group makes their way across.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 168
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GREEN Revision - 8-8-07 106-106A.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE OPPOSITE BANK 169
dialogues.text: Asael pulls people up onto dry ground. They lie there, freezing and exhausted. Some cannot control their shiveri

dialogues.speaker: SHULMAN
dialogues.text: What's next...Sinai? Tuvia can't help but laugh. Soon they are all laughing. It ripples throughout the group. Joyous. Contagious. An overwhelming feeling of relief. They are safe. Tuvia lies on the ground. All the adrenaline has suddenly left his body. Then Aron appears, tugging at his sleeve. Shimon is asking for him. Tuvia kneels down beside his teacher, whose eyes are clos Malbin is weeping quietly. Who will he argue with?

dialogues.speaker: SHIMON
dialogues.text: (a whisper) .Tuvia...

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Right here. Shimon is at the end.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMON
dialogues.text: ...Something...to say...

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Shhhh...

dialogues.speaker: SHIMON
dialogues.text: ...no...please... (finding the strength) I almost lost...my faith....but you...were sent..by God..to save us.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMON
dialogues.text: I know... ... But just...in case... .I thank....HIM... .and I thank you. He closes his eyes. It's too much for Tuvia. Hard as he tries, he cannot stop the tears from filling his eyes. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GREEN Revision - 8-8-07 107.

dialogues.speaker: SUDDENLY
dialogues.text: Trees begin to FALL OVER -- as if pushed by a dinosaur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: emerges onto the banks, less than a quarter-of-mile away.

dialogues.speaker: ITS TURRET BEGINS TO SWIVEL
dialogues.text: The menacing gun turning in their direction.

dialogues.speaker: THE GROUP IS CAUGHT OUT IN THE OPEN. 171
dialogues.text: THE TANK ROARS FIRE. The first round EXPLODES among them. Several are killed.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Back to the river! He pushes people down. They cling to the banks, cowering. THOSE WITH WEAPONS take cover, using the embankment as if it were the lip of a trench. They RETURN FIRE -- old men, young women, even some child

dialogues.speaker: A SQUAD OF GERMAN INFANTRY ADVANCES 172
dialogues.text: behind the tank, using it as protection. Aron kills one. But the Germans are well-trained. They direct a withering fire -- forcing the partisans to keep their heads below the embankment.

dialogues.speaker: BUT THE TANK IS UNSTOPPABLE
dialogues.text: It turns its attentions on the riverbank -- its first rou SAILS OVERHEAD, sending up a huge geyser of water. But the next round PLOWS INTO THE EARTH, tearing a huge chunk of earth and killing two of the brigade. TUVIA grabs a satchel and begins filling it with grenades He throws the satchel over Malbin's head, grabs his arm a races, crouching low, beneath the lip of the riverbank. Asael provides covering fire. So do Lilka, Chaya and the women alongside the men.

dialogues.speaker: UP AHEAD
dialogues.text: A stand of trees hides Tuvia from view as he climbs out o the river and heads into the forest. He pulls Malbin down just as A SQUAD OF GERMAN INFANTRY approaches and begins set up a heavy machine gun. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GREEN Revision - 8-8-07 107A.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Tuvia POPS UP behind them, spraying them with his submach gun. He then turns the heavy machine gun on the infantry advancing behind the tank -- to devastating effect. But now, the tank turns its attention to Tuvia. Its machi gun begins to chew up the forest, forcing Tuvia to take cover. Without pausing to think, Malbin grabs a grenade from the satchel and races toward the tank. It falls pitifully short, exploding harmlessly as Malbin cut down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE BLUE Revision - 9-17-07 108.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA IS NOW ISOLATED AND PINNED DOWN 173
dialogues.text: Bullets tear chunks out of trees as he tries to take cove

dialogues.speaker: THE TURRET SWIVELS IN HIS DIRECTION
dialogues.text: It is only a matter of moments before he is dead.

dialogues.speaker: WHEN SUDDENLY FROM OUT OF THE WOODS
dialogues.text: Zus and the rest of Jewish fighters emerge, firing on the run. Without regard for his own life, Zus charges. The German infantry is caught in a cross-fire as the Biel brigade climbs out the river, firing wildly. Zus guns down the tank commander manning the machine gun from the open hatch. Jumps onto the tank and DROPS A GREN inside. An EXPLOSION of BLACK SMOKE BILLOWS. Zus stands up amid the billowing smoke. He sees Tuvia who is staring back at him.

dialogues.speaker: BOTH GROUPS MEET
dialogues.text: Asael is the first to reach Tuvia, who is carrying the Ge assault machine gun.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Only weapons and ammunition! Spread the word. Tuvia hands him the machine gun.

dialogues.speaker: ASAEL
dialogues.text: Anything else? Tuvia looks at him. Is he fucking with him? Just a little

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Go on. Lilka is carrying a small child.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Lilka, please help. We've got to get the injured into the forest.

dialogues.speaker: LILKA
dialogues.text: What about the dead?

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Everybody gather your things! We have to get out of the open! Nearby, Aron removes the machine from the tank and hands to Zus. Bella approaches. Zus embraces her. Tuvia seizes one of the German rifles. He yells to Shulma

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shulman! Weapons only! Tell them. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE BLUE Revision - 9-17-07 108A.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Shulman follows Tuvia's order.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (throwing the weapon) You've been promoted. Congratulations! Tuvia turns, sees Bella with Zus. They see him. Zus hands Bella the machine gun from the tank and approaches.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where is the rest of your unit?

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: Good question.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: You are going back?

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: No. They look at each other. So much unsaid. No time to say it.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: We've got to build a new camp. Zus nods.

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: Perhaps you have room for one more? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE BLUE Revision - 9-17-07 109.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Tuvia reaches out his arms and they embrace fiercely.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE DEEP WOODS
dialogues.text: They walk in silence. Lilka comes to walk beside him, resting her head on his shoulder as they walk. Tuvia looks up at the shafts of light slanting through th towering trees, as if allowing himself to appreciate its beauty for the first time. Suddenly, he stops, listening, puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Don't you hear it?

dialogues.speaker: ZUS
dialogues.text: What...?

dialogues.speaker: TUVIA
dialogues.text: Nothing. Isn't it beautiful? We HOLD on Tuvia. He has aged ten years in one. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision - 7-18-07 110.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: But for now he allows himself a brief moment of satisfact We might even see the ghost of a smile. But it is short- lived as Asael appears by his side and we see concern onc again clouding his face. Another problem to attend to. And as THE CAMERA BEGINS TO PULL AWAY he is already hurry to catch up with the others. As they all disappear from sight into the sheltering dark of the woods, these words appear on screen: THEY LIVED IN THE FOREST FOR TWO MORE YEARS.

dialogues.speaker: THE OPENING SCENE
dialogues.text: Park Avenue. Traffic. More words on screen: ASAEL JOINED THE RUSSIAN ARMY AND DIED SIX MONTHS LATER. ZUS AND TUVIA EMIGRATED TO THE UNITED STATES. In the taxi, THE ELDERLY MAN thrusts his hand through the slot in the Plexiglas window separating him from the driv

dialogues.speaker: ELDERLY MAN
dialogues.text: Here is money. I can get more. So much more. Take it, please.

dialogues.speaker: CAB DRIVER
dialogues.text: No, no... Indeed, when the CABBIE speaks, though the voice is older and somewhat frail, we recognize it as Tuvia's.

dialogues.speaker: ELDERLY MAN
dialogues.text: What else can I give you, do for you?

dialogues.speaker: AGED TUVIA
dialogues.text: Nothing, it isn't necessary. Tears stream down the elderly man's cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: ELDERLY MAN
dialogues.text: We are alive because of you. (looks at his son) My children. His children. So many. .Thousands. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE CHERRY Revision - 11-1-07 111.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Behind them, HORNS are HONKING. This is New York City.

dialogues.speaker: AGED TUVIA
dialogues.text: Please, the traffic...

dialogues.speaker: ELDERLY MAN
dialogues.text: Bless you, Tuvia Bielski. May the Lord bless you and keep you all the days of your life.

dialogues.speaker: MIDDLE-AGED SON
dialogues.text: Papa, who was that man? The Elderly Man watches the cab pull away, wiping his eye

dialogues.speaker: ELDERLY MAN
dialogues.text: That wasn't a man. That was an angel. As the cab pulls away, the CAMERA CRANES UP until it is lost in an anonymous sea of traffic. These words appear o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: www.vantageawards.com
